1253.content: how about the home of Fluttershy? or perhaps in the middle of the town square
1253.title: More Choices

12532.content:
You didn’t regret leaving Earth. It’s not like you left anything behind. You had no job, no home, no friends or family to turn to. With no real options, for some reason, you got the urge to just pick a direction and start walking. And walking. And walking. You walked for days, until finally you couldn’t walk anymore, and passed out in the dirt. When you woke up, you were in a realm called ‘Equestria’.

It didn’t take long for you to integrate into this new society. While the ponies were a bit shocked and confused when you first stumbled into town, they quickly accepted you once they realized you were harmless. You were more shocked by the sight of the ponies then they were by you, in fact. They were similar to humans, but ultimately, they were like nothing you’d ever seen before. Their fur was fine as silk, with each individual strand of fur being almost invisible to the naked eye, giving them the illusion of having perfect, unblemished skin. Their hair seems to ignore the laws of physics, allowing them to pull off any hairstyle they desire with little to no effort. Some could fly effortlessly through the air; some had powers of telekinesis; some had superhuman strength and endurance. Most curiously, however, is the fact that there seems to be no taboo against public nudity in their society. The ponies walk around town in various stages of dress, a large majority of them being half-naked, if not completely so. It made every interaction you had with the strange creatures incredibly uncomfortable, considering some of their distinctly, er… human features.

You couldn’t really blame them, though, considering you were completely naked yourself. Clothes were considered a luxury in this world, and as such, they were prohibitively expensive for a vagrant like you. But you’ve decided that you were going to change that. You’ve travelled this this town all the way from Baltimare because you’ve heard that the burgeoning town of Ponyville was a land of opportunity. This was the town, you’ve decided, where you would stake your claim and make something out of your life in this magical realm. But first, you needed to get your foot in the door. In a distributist economy like Equestria’s, this would likely mean picking up some odd jobs under craftsmares to save up some bits. However, considering Ponyville is a relatively small town where everyone seemed to know each other, asking around and forging connections would also be beneficial.
12532.title: Unfamiliar Territory

125321.content: The town square of Ponyville was a beautiful and busy place indeed. Merchants had set up large tents throughout the plaza, showing off their finest wares to passers-by. Other, more enterprising individuals sorted through the waves of immigrants pouring into the town, offering them a place as apprentices. Basically, this was a position of doing menial grunt work under more skilled craftsmares in exchange for lodging and a paltry salary, as well as some secrets of their trade. This was a good opportunity in case you want to take up a particular craft, or join a guild. Interestingly enough, there was also a few wanted posters nailed up to a notice board outside the town hall. While it was dangerous and not the kind of thing you’ve ever done before, they offered exorbitant bounties. If you managed to bring in one of the bandits that had been harassing the locals, you’d be set for life.
125321.title: Finding Work

1253211.content:
One of the more conventional jobs offered was at a place called ‘Sweet Apple Acres’. Apparently one of the workers-- ‘Big Mac’, you think his name was-- had to take a trip to Appleloosa to settle a family crisis, and the farm needed someone to do their grunt work for a while. Agriculture and construction work seemed to be among the few occupations relegated specifically to the non-unicorn and non-pegasus crowd, who didn’t have all the fancy magical powers. So those careers might be your best bet… even if you don’t feel particularly keen on moving from one life of menial labor to another. It wasn’t technically an apprenticeship, and it wasn’t even associated with any guild, but it would help you become considered a friend of the Apple family, who collectively own over 90% of Equestria’s farmland. So if you’ve ever wanted to become a farmer, nows your chance.

But if you were interested in more intellectual pursuits, the Guild of the Arcane Arts was offering an apprenticeship in theurgy under one of their master craftsmares, Twilight Sparkle. Theurgy was a form of magic that is performed with ritual and incantation, and doesn’t require a horn. It was one of the most arduous crafts to learn, but if you managed it, you could perform amazing supernatural feats. It was definitely a more exciting prospect than anything you’ve encountered on Earth.
1253211.title: Menial Labor

12532111.content:
Farming has always been your passion, but it was never something you could pursue back on Earth. Now that you were starting a new life for yourself, this seemed like the perfect opportunity. You found this ‘Applejack’ running a cart near the edge of the town square, selling apple bushels, apple pies, apple cider, baseball caps with ‘I ❤ APPLES’ scribbled on their fronts... anything related to apples, really. She herself was, as you expected, half-naked, wearing nothing but a green vest with an apple logo on the collar and a goofy cowboy hat, but at least it was more than most ponies around here wore. She was quite a few years older than you were-- around 29, you’d estimate-- and was obviously athletic, while not being overly muscular.

“Why, if it isn’t the human I’ve heard so much about!” Applejack smiled, as she enthusiastically shook your hand. She apparently didn’t know her own strength, and you felt like she was going to shake your arm right out of its socket. “Pleasure to meet you! I’m Applejack.”

“Thomas,” you return with a curt nod as you rub your now sore shoulder, before looking down at the various apple-themed coffee mugs on sale. “You sure do seem to like apples.”

“Yessir!” Applejack nodded. “September’s right around the corner, so I have to clear out the stockpiles a bit. Anyway, would you like some apples?”

“I’m not here to buy anything.” You shake your head. “I’m actually interested in the apprenticeship.”

“Oh, wow! And I was starting to think I was going to have to call in family members from out of town.” Applejack remarked, excited. “Ponies ‘round these parts don’t understand the importance of hard work and concentration. Want everything served up easy to ‘em, imported from Appleloosa or wherever. It’s good to hear you humans are made of sterner stuff!”

“Uh, thanks.” You shrug. “So you run that huge farm off the outskirts of town, I understand? What made you start taking apprentices?”

“We’re a little short-handed down at the farm right now, as you might’ve heard, and Applebucking season’s coming up,” Applejack sighs. “Besides, I’m at an age where I really should be taking apprentices. Gotta keep the applebucking business alive, you know?”

You could tell this ‘Applejack’ is definitely a kind-hearted and trustworthy woman, though maybe a little overbearing. You continue to chat for almost an hour on the prospect of your apprenticeship, occasionally pausing so she can serve customers, until you finally decide that it’s something you want to do, and she decides that it’s something you’re capable of doing. You end up signing an indenture which binds you as her apprentice for a flexible period of time, basically meaning you are obligated to perform whatever jobs she assigns to you and, in turn, she is responsible for your housing and well-being, as well as educating you in the ways of her craft. By the end of it all, you’ll be a friend of the apple family, a member of Ponyville’s merchant guild, and-- if you go for the full three years-- you'll end up considered a journeyman in agriculture, and be entitled to five acres of arable land. Unfortunately, the salary will be next to nothing, so you’ll pretty much have to rely on Applejack for everything you need.

As night falls, the mare wraps up the stall, and you walk with her back to her farm, ‘Sweet Apple Acres’. Your heart skips a beat as you inadvertently lay eyes on her bare rear swaying hypnotically as she walked, obviously toned by years of athleticism. You were still getting used to the pony society’s tendency to go around basically nude, and tried not to stare, but you couldn’t help but take a few quick glances.

“My sister just started with her apprenticeship at the farm, so you’ll be probably working along with her. Might even bring in a third apprentice sometime too. I certainly have the extra room, what with my brother down in Appleloosa,” Applejack said as she walked.

Eventually, you reach the front path of sweet apple acres. The cold night stung your skin and the rocky dirt roads were uncomfortable beneath your feet as you passed by rows and rows of apple trees. From this angle, the apple trees seemed to cover the earth from horizon to horizon like an ocean, stretching as far as the eye could see. “Wow,” you gasp. “That is… that is a lot of apple trees we’re going to have to harvest.”

“Yep!” Applejack confirmed, as if it was something she hears a lot. “Why do you think I need extra help with the harvest?”

Finally, you reach the large home in the dead center of the endless apple fields. You immediately breathe a sigh of relief as you step inside, as you felt the heat coming off from the fireplace. It was definitely cozy inside, though the overly flashy exterior made the house look like it was a lot bigger than it actually was. That was typical of pony agriculture, however. Applejack showed you your room-- a humble little room with nothing but a small bed, a drawer, and a window. You don’t even get a lamp.

“I’ll just let you get settled in for tonight. It’s too late to start working now.” Applejack yawned, as she pulled off her hat and vest and hanged them on a rack by the front door, exposing her firm breasts and golden blond hair. “I’ll start training you tomorrow morning, so get some sleep-- you’ll need it!”

You thank her for everything, and she disappears up the stairs, presumably heading to her room. You put what little you own in the drawer, and flop onto the bed. You were already exhausted by the train ride here, so a little rest was all you needed, and you were glad you had already found a comfy place to stay and didn’t have to hop from hotel room to hotel room anymore. With that thought, you slowly drift into a deep sleep.
12532111.title: Applebucking Season

125321111.content:
You wake up at sunrise the next day. That was the best sleep you’ve had in months. You shambled out of the bedroom to see Applejack standing in the kitchen, already wide-awake, looking presentable as ever even this early in the morning. “Mornin’.” Applejack called over her shoulder. “You’re up just in time.

“Good morning,” you respond as you rub the sleep from your eye, taking a seat at the closest chair.

“Hope ya don’t mind, but to welcome you to the family, I cooked up something special.” Applejack smiled. “Give the Baltimare boy his first taste of down home Apple family cookin’.”

“What? Oh, you didn’t have to-” You try to reply, but are interrupted as Applejack drops a dish down on the dining table in front of you. It appeared to be some kind of pie, though ultimately not like any pastry you’ve ever laid eyes on. Whatever it was, it smelled absolutely delicious. “What is this? Some kind of apple pie, I presume?”

“You could call it that, but with a bit of a twist.” Applejack chuckled cryptically, before walking up the stairwell. “Enjoy. I’ll go wake up Applebloom.”

You stare at the dish for a while, before shrugging and taking a bite. You were immediately blindsided by its flavor! Every bite was like fireworks going off in your mouth. You had heard that there were certain mythical ingredients around Equestria that gave food a literally supernatural flavor-- you assume one of those is the Apple family’s secret ingredient. If this is what their food tastes like, it’s no wonder they’re so renowned. Once you were about halfway done with the pie, you hear a loud thump from upstairs, following by the sound of two mares arguing.

“Do you really have to shove me out of bed!?”
“You weren’t getting up! Breakfast was going to get cold. Besides, you’ve got work to do.”

This argument continued for a few moments, until you finally see Applejack returning down the stairs, followed by a younger mare. This mare had light yellow fur and a red mane, and looked to be much closer to your age-- she looked about 19, you’d say. You assume that this is the sister Applejack had been talking about. She looked plainly disgruntled at having to get up so early, before stopping in her tracks once she sees you sitting there having breakfast. “Uh… why is the human sitting at our table?”

“That’s the new apprentice, sugarcube!” Applejack smiled. “Applebloom, meet Thomas! Thomas, Applebloom.”

The younger mare looked slightly confused for a moment, before chuckling. “Oh. So you finally found somepony, huh?”

“Yes, I did, and we’re going to treat him with respect.” Applejack declared, preemptively. “Since he’s so kind to help us out at the farm for so little in return.”

“Well, it’s nice to meet you, then, Thomas.” The young mare shrugged as she sat down at the dining table across from you. She looked lean, but not nearly as athletic or muscular as Applejack.

“Now you two get acquainted.” Applejack demanded, kindly but sternly as she put her cowboy hat on and walked out onto the porch. “After y’all are done with breakfast, we’re going out to teach Thomas here how to work the fields.”

You two sit for a while, eating your delicious meals, before Applebloom broke the silence. “So, what brings a human like you here?” She asked, idly. “When I first heard about you, I figured you would end up in Canterlot or somewhere.”

“I’m trying to start a new life here in Equestria, and Ponyville just seemed like the right place.” You shrug. “Big cities don’t really appeal to me, and rustic small towns like Appleloosa don’t either. This seemed like a happy medium.”

“Oh? Guess I can understand that.” She said, in between bites. “I’ve been hearing that you weren’t born here-- in Equestria, I mean-- you’re here from some other dimension. Is that… is that true?”

“Pretty much,” you sigh. “Maybe not another dimension, but another world, definitely. It was a bit like this pony world, but full of humans like me instead.”

“Hm...” She grunts, as she stares down at her plate, as if pondering your words. “So… you had to leave all that behind? Did you know anypony there?”

You sigh, leaning back in your chair. “I didn’t leave anything behind. Not really,” you frown, reminiscing. “Of course, I miss my old world a lot… but really, there was nothing for me here. You ponies are an odd bunch, but you’re much better than the people I left behind.”

She nods. You can tell she was still curious, and still had questions she wanted to ask, but decided not to press the issue, worried she might ask something too personal. You were fine with that. It wasn’t really the kind of thing you liked to talk about, anyway. You both finished your breakfast quickly, and Applejack led you out into the fields after you all grab a few big woven baskets each. “First off, you’ll have to learn to tell when the apples are ripe, ‘cause for most of the year you’re going to be picking ‘em one-by-one,” Applejack instructed as you all walked down the path. “After that, we’ll learn about buckin’ trees. This’ll only come in handy next month, when almost all the apples are ripe, but it’ll definitely save time.”

You finally reached a particularly huge apple tree, and Applejack stops the admire it. “Here we are. The first apple tree in Ponyville, planted by ol’ Granny herself.” Applejack smiles. “It’s where I first learned to pick apples, and it’s where you’ll learn, too.”

“It’s, uh… huge,” you comment, looking up at the tree. “I’m pretty sure we’re not going to reach those branches, unless you brought a ladder.”

Applejack laughed at the notion. “A ladder? We’re going to be hauling around a good couple dozen bushels of apples, sugarcube, I’d hate to have to carry around a cumbersome ladder, too,” Applejack shakes her head. “No. You’re just gonna climb up there. Show ‘im how it’s done, Applebloom.”

“Me? Why do I have to do it? He’s you’re apprentice,” Applebloom complained, folding her arms.

“Yeah, well, last time I checked, you’re my apprentice too, and you know what they say-- the best way to learn is to teach,” Applejack says smugly. “Now hop to it!”

Before you could react, the young mare rolls her eyes before stepping towards the tree, grabbing a low-hanging branch, and hoisting herself on top of it with surprising strength and flexibility. You guessed you misjudged her athleticism. “Your turn,” she called down from her perch upon the branch. You shrugged, and similarly tried to pull yourself up onto a branch. Gravity seemed to be much weaker in the world of Equestria, which made the lifting easier, but you just weren’t flexible enough. Applebloom giggled a bit as she watched you struggle. “Wow! Guess you really are a city boy after all.”

“Shut it!” You yell as you finally sloppily land yourself on a branch, sitting across from the mare. She laughs, before suddenly twisting an apple of her branch and tossing it to you.

“Catch!” she yells, and you almost fall off your branch as you scramble to catch the apple as it soars towards you. Luckily, you keep your balance, and scowl at the mare as she laughs once again at your sloppiness. “Now tell me… is it ripe?” You inspect the apple, and see that it was perfectly red-- about as pristine as an apple could be, you guessed. You nod to her. “Oh? Then take a bite.”

You take a bite from the apple, only to immediately spit it out and start coughing. It was disgusting! Once you recovered, you looked at the bite you took, and noticed that the apple was pure black on the inside. “What the hell kind of apples are these?”

“No kind of apple you’ve ever seen, that’s for sure. They’re a bit of an Apple family secret,” Applebloom chuckles. “They can either be the best thing you’ve ever tasted, or the worst. That’s why you have to learn to pick ‘em when they’re juuust right.”

You knew it! They were using magical ingredients. You look down in disgust and wonderment at the malformed apple in your hand. This was going to be more complicated than you thought.

***

Over the new hour, Applebloom explains to you the basics of these strange, enchanted apples. Just telling whether one of these apples were ripe was a surprisingly complicated process, and you couldn’t help but be in awe at the level of quality control the apple family put into their produce.Meanwhile, Applejack sat up against the tree beneath the two of you, relaxing.

“You done yet?” Applejack calls. “I’m going to have to start working the fields myself, so if you want to learn how to buck apple trees, you’re going to want to tag along.”

“I don’t think he fully gets this yet,” Applebloom notes. “No point in teaching him how to harvest if he can’t even tell if they’re ripe, right?”

“I guess the applebucking lesson can wait until tomorrow,” Applejack shrugs. “Or he can come with me, and you two can wrap this lesson up tomorrow. Whichever way.”
125321111.title: A Lesson in Apples.

1253211111.content:
“I'm getting a little tired of staring at apples for now.” You say, hopping sloppily down from the tree. “I think I'll go with Applejack.”

“Alright, well, I'll just keep picking apples, I guess.” Applebloom shrugs, as you and Applejack wander off deeper into the orchard. You completely lose all direction amidst the confusing tangle of apple trees, but apparently Applejack knows the orchard like the back of her hand, and navigates easily even without any apparent landmarks. Eventually, she stops in front of a particularly flimsy tree.

“Here! This one's perfect.” She decides by whatever criteria, as she pushes her hand against the tree, and it tips over slightly. “First, though, do you have any idea what applebucking is?”

“Not a clue.” You shake your head.

“Right. Well, during the months when you can be pretty sure all the apples are ripe, you can save time by kicking the tree just hard enough to knock down every apple at once.” She explains, while setting down the straw baskets in a circle on the ground around another, larger tree, and slipping on some steel-toed boots. “Let me demonstrate.”

She rears up and kicks the tree with a stunning amount of speed and strength, and even the sturdy-looking tree shook violently, looking like it was on the verge of breaking free from its roots. A few dozen apples rain into the baskets below. You whistle. You knew that Earth Ponies naturally had incredible strength and endurance, but this was almost superhuman. She admired her handiwork, before handing you the boots. “Here, you try.” You approach the thinner tree, nervously. If she could knock every apple out of that massive tree, surely you could accomplish the same with this flimsy one? You try kicking the tree with the same technique she showed, over and over again. No give. “Come on! You can't buck a single apple tree?” She spurs you on.

You snort with determination, before bracing yourself against a nearby pole for some more stability, before rearing up and slamming the heel of your boot into the tree with all your might. To your elation, it works this time, and the tree gives way, dropping a barrage of apples onto the ground below. “There you go! I knew ya could do it.” She raises a fist. “You're no earth pony, but you're still tougher than the unicorns, at least.”

“Uhh... thanks, I guess.” You reply. You continue to practice as the hours tick by, taking whatever pointers Applejack gives you. You get better at the technique, but you still struggle to kick with even half as much power as Applejack manages. You lack the innate magical abilities of most of the races, but it was comforting to know that with some dedication, you may eventually match them.

Before you know it, the sun begins to dip beneath the mountains, and nightfall is upon you. “Looks like it's about time to wrap this up,” she noted, wiping the dust off her hands. “Let's head back.”

She walks back towards the house, and you follow her, limping and whimpering as a result of your now aching hamstrings. As you walk, you decide to get to know her a bit. “So... this farm is struggling, it seems? I figured a farm like this would be too big to fail by now.”

“Everypony assumes that, but to be honest, the farm doesn't exactly have the odds stacked in it's favor. The only reason it's still alive is all the hard work the family's put in.” Applejack shrugs. “But yeah. The farm is struggling.”

“Just not enough hands on deck to cover the workload?”

“Exactly. The house seems emptier and emptier every year. First it was my folks... then it was granny... now Big Mac's ran off to Appleloosa...” Applejack sighs as she walks. “Once she's done with her apprenticeship, Applebloom will likely run off, too, and it'll be just me out here. I don't know how I'll take care of the farm then.”

“What makes you think Applebloom will leave?” You ask.

“Same reason Big Mac left. With all that's possible nowadays, who wants to be cooped up on some farm their whole lives?” Applejack asks, rhetorically. “I won't fault her if she leaves. Not at all. I want her to go and do what makes her happy. I'm just... I'm sorry. I don't mean to complain.”

“It's fine,” you nod. You could tell she was frustrated, but you didn't know what you should say. The both of you walk back to the house in silence. You step inside and take a seat by the fireplace, warming yourself, as Applejack takes her hat off and hangs it up by the front door. “Well, good job today! You may not be as naturally skilled as earth ponies, but you sure do learn quickly,” Applejack smiles, laying a hand on your shoulder.

“Thanks. I did my best,” you shrug with a yawn.

“Now get some sleep tonight. You'll be getting some real work done tomorrow,” she instructs, and you eventually walk back to your room. You lay down on your bed, which creaks underneath you. You stare at the ceiling for a while, before your eyes center on a small framed photo resting on the drawer next to you. It depicted Applejack, smiling, with her arm slung over the shoulder of a bulky, shy-looking red stallion. I guess that's Big Mac, you think to yourself. It was a bit of a depressing note, given the circumstances, but you push the thought out of your mind to get a good night's sleep.
1253211111.title: Applebucking Technique

12532111111.content:
The next morning, you emerge from your bedroom, rubbing the sleep from your eyes. You stumbled idly through the house until you walked into the dining room, and saw Applejack in the kitchen, wearing an adorable apron, cooking something that smelled absolutely delicious. She smiled as she heard you walk in. “Wow, you're up late. I was just about to wake you up myself,” she notes.

“Good morning,” you responded, simply.

“Good morning,” she nodded, as she set down a slice of apple pie hot out of the oven, among other pastries, on the dining room table in front of you. “You're just in time for lunch.”

“Oh, you didn't have to...” you said, even though internally you were licking your lips at the sight of the delicious meal before you.

“Don't worry about it, sugarcube,” she smiled warmly, as you lazily sat down one on of the uncomfortable but quaint wooden seats. “I'm more than happy to cook for you and Applebloom while you focus on your apprenticeship. Besides, I've got the best pastry recipes this side of the Grange. It would be selfish to hog 'em all to myself.”

You didn't want to argue with that. You were too busy digging into the delicious plate in front of you. You hated cooking, anyway. Plus, while you figured everything Applejack cooked would be some apple-based recipe or another, there was actually a surprising amount of variety in the humble meal. Applejack ate across from you, with slightly less fervor. “Should Applebloom be here?”

“She's out in the fields right now. She skips lunch, sometimes,” she responded between bites. “Why?”

“Just wondering. She seems nice.” You shrug. “And happy on the farm. Are you sure she wants to leave?”

“Of course she seems happy. She isn't the type to complain. Big Mac wasn't, either. But when your family's frustrated, you can just tell,” she sighed, staring at an apple in her hands, idly.

“You really like apples, don't you?” You notice.

She laughed. “Yeah. I'm always getting that. Everypony always pokes fun of ol' Applejack and her apples. They think I'm just obsessed with 'em,” she chuckled. “But there's more to it than that. I don't really have the fancy words to describe it, but... they make me think of family. You know? These apples, this orchard... they've been with me my whole life. They remind me of the good ol' days.”

“Yeah, I get it.” You nod, having finished your plate. “This farm's important to you, eh?”

“Of course! It's important to everypony in town... or at least, it should be. All of Ponyville was built around this humble little farm.” Applejack insisted.

“Really?” You ask as you push in your chair.

“Yup! Apple family started this farm a few decades ago, and a whole town sprung up around it.” Applejack recalled.

“A few decades? This town is pretty big. I figured it would be older than that.”

“Seems like it, huh? In just a few dozen years, over thirty six hundred ponies made their homes here. Mighty impressive, ain't it?” Applejack said.

“So what are we doing today, anyway?” You ask as you step to the front door, feeling the sun pouring in and bearing down on your chest.

“We still have a few weeks until September, so you have time to get some more training done.” Applejack rubbed her hands before putting on her quaint cowboy hat and emerging from the house.

As you followed her back into the orchard, you have to ask, “So, uh, I’ve been wondering… do you have any spare clothes around the farmhouse I could wear?”

She gives you an odd look. “What for? Are you planning on going to the gala or somethin’?” She asked, confused.

“No,” you sighed, wringing your hands, frustrated that you have to explain this to somepony again. “Back in my world, everyone wore clothes, basically all the time. So it’s a bit uncomfortable for me to be walking around like this.”

“Really? You used to wear clothes all the time? Sounds like it would be mighty inconvenient...” She tilts her head, incredulous. “Well, Big Mac owned a nice suit that would probably fit you, but he took it with him when he left. But I do know a boutique in the city. Maybe we could go you somethin’ there on the weekend, custom fitted?”

“That would be great,” you smile, before getting to work.

---


A few hours later, you tread back along the dirt road back to the house. You were panting from exhaustion and drenched in sweat, but you felt victorious. You had made good progress in your training, and the earth pony seemed impressed by your adaptability. “Good job out there today, city boy. You keep this up, and you’ll be buckin’ apples with the best of ‘em,” The mare in question complimented, placing a hand on your shoulder. “And now’s the time to unwind with a nice shower and a belly full of apple pie. Sound good?”

“Sounds perfect,” you call, as you lay on the dusty, itchy old couch, getting your bearings. Your whole body ached after a hard day’s work at the barn, but you didn’t mind. It felt… fulfilling, somehow. Like you were finally putting in an honest day’s work. Applejack’s company made it all the sweeter -- she really seemed like an amazing woman. It’s a shame you never met someone like her back on earth, or you would never be in this mess. Later, you couldn’t help but gasp a little bit when you laid eyes on Applejack’s “shower”. You knew the ponies were old-fashioned, but this was ridiculous. The “shower” consisted of nothing but a curtain and a barrel, which was carefully positioned on the ceiling so it could rain water on those below. It looked absolutely medieval. “We’re going to be showering... together?”

“Well of course.” She said, nonchalantly. “Don’t want to waste water, do ya?” She pulled on a crank, which caused water to loudly flow down from the barrel and through a grate, rolling over the mare’s muscular body as she gestures for you to join her. For a brief moment, you thought she might be flirting with you, until you remembered that the ponies have incredibly different social conventions then you’re used to. For her, this might be the most normal thing in the world. Not wanting to seem rude, you join her beneath the ‘shower’, wincing at how freezing cold the water was. Still, even this wasn’t enough to distract you from the mare standing inches in front of you, the water pressing her fur against her body and further bringing out her curves. You were used to being around the naked ponies by this point, but something about being so close made your heart beat out of your chest. Despite your attempts to remain professional, your body betrayed you.

You shudder as your hard shaft accidentally brushes against her firm flank. You hold your breath as Applejack turns to you, but upon seeing your predicament, she simply chuckles. “Oh, sorry. You did say you were used to some modesty, didn’t ya?” She chuckled, uncomfortably. “This may be a mite awkward, then. Heh!” You guess that in a world where everyone is incredibly attractive and constantly naked, situations like these must not be all that unexpected. She scoots away from you a bit, giving you some room to breathe; but your manhood remains up and at attention, unable to calm yourself while you have such a perfect view of the beautiful woman’s back. A couple minutes later, she turns around again, grimacing when she notices how tense you still are. “Hm. Well, you’re might pent-up, arentcha?” She ponders, and you blush in embarrassment as she looks down curiously at your shaft. “Want me to take of that for you, sugarcube?”

“W-what are you talking about?” You took a step back, shocked at the proposal. She was your boss, and you had assumed she would never be anything more.

“Heh, no need to freak out! Nothin’ to be embarrassed about,” she chuckled nonchalantly, as if this was the most normal thing in the world. “Not like I’m proposing we buck or anything. Just offering to relieve some tension. That’s all.” You stared at the ground, your heart thumping in your chest. You knew ponies were open about such things, but you never knew they were this casual. You had only met the mare a few days ago! You turn around, overcome by your conflicting emotions. On one hand, this level of forwardness -- from your own boss! -- was crazy… but on the other, you couldn’t deny your piercing desire. “I understand if you’re not so comfortable with that sort of thing,” she frowned, remembering that humans might not be as open with their sexuality… but hearing the disappointment in her voice was the tipping point for you.

1253211111112.title: Something Unusual Happens

1253211112.content:
“Actually, I think I'll stay here. I think I'm just about to figure this whole thing out,” you decide.

"Alright. See you tonight,” Applejack snorts, apparently amused, before walking off deeper into the orchard. You began the arduous process of learning how to decipher the ripeness of one of these strange enchanted apples at a glance. It was a confusing and complicated task, but it seemed there really was a science to it, and you were slowly getting better at telling whether one of these apples were ripe at a glance. You and Applebloom managed to make some small talk while you were at it, and you enjoyed her company. She seemed nice enough.

“See? You're getting the hang of it!” She smiles as you triumphantly toss another ripe apple into the basket below. The sun was on the verge of setting, and the valley of trees grew darker with every passing moment. “I think that's enough training for one day. AJ will be back soon, anyway.”

"Alright. Should we just head back to the house?” You ask.

“Hmm... actually, nah. Here, there's something cool out here you should see,” she calls, hopping down from the tree. You try to hop down from your branch as gracefully as she did, but end up losing your balance and landing on your arse on the ground. She giggles as you stand up and dust yourself off, before grabbing your hand and excitedly leading you deeper through the weave of trees that made up the vast orchard. Eventually, you were led into a small clearing with a large tree in the middle, with a quaint and frankly impressively large tree house attached. You both walk up the stairs, and pull the small wooden door open, only to be hit in the face by a gust of stale air. The tree house looked like it hadn't been touched in years.

“This is my old tree house, from way back when. I almost forgot about this place.” she announces as she takes a look around the room, opening up the single small window to let some fresh air in. You walk in after her, having to duck just to keep your head from hitting the ceiling. You two sit next to each other under the windowsill, staring at the beams of light shining in, listening to the sounds of birds chirping as nightfall approaches.

“It's pretty impressive.” You whistle. “Don't think I've ever seen a children's tree house that was this big.”

“Yeah, Applejack and my brother built it for me when I was little. They have a knack for this kind of thing.” she smiles as she digs through some drawers in the corner, to find some red sheets with emblems crudely stitched onto their sides. “And hey! These are capes we used to wear.”

“'We'?” You ask.

“Yeah! I used to come up here with my friends all the time when I was a kid.” she reminisces excitedly, as the memories flood back to her.

You noticed she looked a little bit forlorn as she stared at the old sheets. “Is something wrong?”

“What? Oh, no, I'm just getting all nostalgic. I just miss my old friends, you know? But I'm happy for them. They ended up going off and doing all these great things. ” Applebloom sighed, staring at the dirty, wrinkled capes-- all that remained of a time long past. “One went to some fancy college all the way up in Canterlot, and the other joined the Wonderbolt Academy... and I'm still just stuck here, on the same ol' farm.”

“You don't like it here?” You ask.

“No, I mean, I do. This farm has taken care of me, for all my life,” Applebloom shrugged. “I just figured I'd go on to do something more, you know? I've already been on this farm my whole life, and... to think, in ten, twenty years, I'll probably still be here, is just...”

“No, no, I understand. I used to feel just like that back on Earth. Working a farm like this has always been my true passion, but I was stuck in this boring, dead-end job, and I was too scared to go out and try something different.” you recall wistfully. “Seemed like I couldn't do anything else, yeah? It was all I'd ever done.”

“Yeah.” Applebloom nodded, understanding. “But... you are working at a farm now.”

“Yeah. See, eventually, I get fed up with it all. So I just stopped ovethinking everything, and just did what I felt I needed to do... and I ended up here, doing exactly what I always wanted, in a world populated by some of the friendliest people I've ever met,” you explain as you gaze out the small wooden window. “Maybe my story's a bit unusual, but still. You want my advice? Just don't be afraid to follow your gut, and things will get better, one way or another. Trust me.”

Applebloom sat there, staring down at the tarnished capes, digesting your words. After a moment, the young mare pushed the drawer closed, not wanting to reminisce any longer. “I wish it were that easy,” she sighed.

“Hey! Are you two up there?” You hear a call. You look outside to see Applejack standing below the treehouse, carrying a lantern and multiple big baskets full of apples.

“Oh, yeah, yeah, we're up here!” Applebloom called back, poking her head out the window.

“I've been looking for you two!” Applejack folded her arms as she watched the both of you duck out of the tiny door and walk down the stairs. “Just what were you up in the treehouse for?”

“We was just talkin',” Applebloom said as she reached the bottom of the stars, shivering as she emerged into the dark, cold night.

“I said not to go up there anymore,” Applejack recalled. “That house is falling apart.”

“Yeah, yeah,” Applebloom muttered. As the chilly autumn months press down on Equestria, you really start to wish clothes weren't considered such a luxury. Applejack gives you both a few baskets each to carry, which were far heavier than they looked, and you all wander back towards the barn.

“How did the training go?” Applejack asked as you walked inside and set the baskets down on the floor.

“I think he's got it.” Applebloom informed, ethusiastically.

“Good, good.” Applejack nodded, as she hung her hat up by the door and relaxed on a reclining chair by the fireplace. “Now you should get some rest, Thomas. You're getting up early tomorrow. I'm gonna teach you everything I know about the art of applebucking.”

“Gladly,” You yawn. You crash on your bed, curling up in the comfortable blankets once again, as you slowly drift off to sleep.

12532121.content:
The rainbow-haired mare intrigued you. A 500 Bit reward? One simple adventure, and you could solve your cash problems for a long time. Tempted, you consider your options. She was apparently last seen near the Arimaspi Territory, in the distant south, which sure sounded dangerous, and she certainly looked intimidating. But for some reason, you weren’t concerned. If one thing has been consistent in your travels across Equestrian, you’ve always inevitably run into trouble. Why wait for it to find you?

You spent what little remained of your bits on supplies, some clothes, and a train ticket. That afternoon, you were riding a quaint little train a hundred miles south, past the mountains, while counting up your supplies and trying to determine how long they’d last you. As far as you could tell, you had to wrap this little expedition up in less than two weeks. After determining that, you simply stared at your window and admired the countryside rolling by. By the time the train stopped anywhere near your destination, it was already well into the evening… and you still had a lot of traveling to do. Slinging your pack of supplies over your shoulder, you take the rest of the journey on foot. Tonight, you decided, you would find a place to set up camp first, and start searching for your bounty target in the morning.

You march through the dense, arduous forest environment, and thank your lucky stars that you had managed to buy some comfortable clothing in town. You could see why the bandit mare would be hiding out here - this place was seemingly empty of life. The dry, skeletal trees swayed in the moonlight, like long fingers reaching up towards the sky. The shrubbery was so dense, you struggled to find a clearing to settle down in. After traveling aimlessly through the darkened woods, you saw an even more ominous sight - a single cabin in the distance, far from civilization. Your immediately immediately assumed that this might be the house of the bandit mare, but, taking a cautious peek through a window, you confirm that it was empty. In fact, it looked like nobody had visited the place in years. You were ecstatic. It was the perfect place to settle down.

You lay out your gear, and take a look around the cabin. It had one bedroom, one restroom, and a small living room consisting of nothing more than a couch, a table, and a window. It was so small, you wonder how anyone couldn’t stood to live in this place long term. There was no electricity, but you did find a generator, so you could probably get lights as well if you could find fuel for it. As you settled down for the night on the couch, munching on one of the sandwiches you brought with you, you heard cracking noises coming from deeper in the woods. Gun shots! That must be the bandit! In your excitement, you had almost forgotten how perilous this area was.

You step towards the door frame, straining your ears. It sounded as if the bandit was having a firefight of some sort. You weren’t prepared to go after her tonight, but this may be your chance to arrest her while she’s distracted. Then again, you might get shot. Were you willing to risk it?

Of the supplies you had bought in town, you had obtained some first-aid tools specifically for injuries such as this, so you were able to bandage up her wound and prevent her condition from getting any worse.

After this, you crashed on the couch, considering what had happened over the night. It had certainly been an interesting turn of events. You came here expecting to arrest the highwaymare, and now all you had done is saved her life. But you would get a bigger reward if you brought the bandit in alive than dead, anyway. You resolved that you would ask her what the situation was tommorow. In the meantime, after such an exhausting day, it was about time you got some sleep...
125321211.title: Unexpected Alliance

1253212111.content:
You woke early the next morning, to the nostalgic sound of chirping birds in the forest outside. You sit up on the couch and stretch, shaking the cobwebs off yourself. After spending so long in the cities full of nosey and overly-social ponies, being able to spend some time in an isolated cabin like this was a breath of fresh air. After relaxing a bit and having a meager breakfast, you remember why you’re here. You find the rainbow-maned mare laying on her side, still in a deep sleep. She should wake up soon, you hoped, unless she was in a coma or something. You couldn’t help but notice how attractive she was. She was sleek and slightly muscular; obviously a pretty serious athlete. Her exposed breasts were smaller than the average mare’s, but still firm and perky. You tried not to stare while you replaced her bloodied bandages with clean ones.

As you were fumbling to cook something on the crude iron stove, the noise of your struggles seemed to stir the mare. Her eyes slid open, and she seemed relaxed at first, then suddenly terrified when she realized she didn’t recognize her surroundings. “W-who… the hay are you? Where am I!?” she yelled, trying to jump up from the bed, only for her wound to force her to lay back down.

“Whoa, whoa, calm down!” You called back, trying to calm her down before she hurt herself. “I rescued you, I rescued you.”

She laid on her back, gripping her bandage wound, still wincing in pain. Realizing that she wasn’t going to go anywhere with an injury like this, she turned her attention to you. “Wh… who… who are you?” she panted quietly, as she waited for the pain in her belly to alleviate.

“I'm Thomas,” You said, sitting at a chair by her bedside. “Don’t you remember? You were running away from those bounty hunters. I helped you.”

She stared you down for a second, her expression indecipherable, before starting to laugh quietly to herself. “Heh… these games are never going to end, are they?” she whispered, plopping her head on her pillow.

“What do you mean?” You asked, as you walked back to fiddle with the iron oven some more.

“I’ll tell you later,” she yawned, rolling around onto her side. “So… is there any particular reason I’m naked?”

“Your clothes were ruined. I don’t have any spares. Sorry.” You explained, sheepishly. Before she could respond, you pulled a wooden bowl from the oven, full of warm oils and broth and chunks of vegetables, and sat by her bed. “I made something to eat, if you’re hungry.”

“Oh! Uh, wow, thanks,” she said, looking surprise at your hospitality as she took the bowl in her hands. You focused on trying to get the generator working while she ate the soup in silence. “Why are you doing all of this for me?” She asked suddenly, cutting through the silence. You grimace. You hadn’t thought to prepare for this. How were you going to explain to her that you were a bounty hunter, too? Would she think the only reason you saved her was to claim the bounty?

He knows that he could be losing a friend or alliance if he tells her the truth but it's better than having a friendship based off a lie. "I have to tell you something first Ms.Dash." "What?" "I am a Bounty Hunter as well." Rainbow tries to get up but the wound forces her back down. "So I'm guessing you just want the money?" "*sigh* That's what I thought at first but then I saw those other Bounty Hunters look even more evil then you ever could. So I want to help you." Rainbow Dash took some time to think about it. 12532121111.title: You tell the truth.

12532122.content:
‘Rarity’ didn’t look like she’d be too dangerous. You were surprised to see a mare like her even had a bounty on her head, in fact. But either way, you start walking over to the boutique where she purportedley spends most of her time. After a few hours of asking around Ponyville, you finally find it. You knock on the door, and hear the muffled voice of a mare from inside. “Come in!” You take a step inside the boutique, and see the mare from the poster come walking down a stairwell to greet you. You had to admit-- she was drop-dead gorgeous in person. Instead of the gawdy dress she had been wearing on the poster, she was instead wearing a more modest black pencil skirt, a purple button-down shirt that matched her mane, and beautiful white gem-encrusted heels. She was definitely dressed with Canterlot sensibilities in mind, and almost looked a bit out-of-place amidst Ponyville ponies, who just dressed in whatever was comfortable.

“Oh! You must be the human I’ve heard so much about!” She seemed shocked by your appearance for a moment, before smiling apologetically. “You’ll have to forgive me, I’ve never met a human before.”

“Oh, I don’t mind. I’m used to getting, uh… mixed responses,” You shrug. “You must be Rarity, right? The seamstress?”

“Why, yes! I see my reputation precedes me,” Rarity smiles, almost as if flattered that the globe-trotting outsider would be able to recognize her so quickly. It wasn’t that hard, though, with her face plastered around town. Perhaps she didn’t know she had a bounty on her head? Or maybe she was just playing dumb?

“Well, you are obviously a master of your craft,” You say, looking over the variety of dresses on displays scattered around the boutique. They were all beautiful, beyond anything you’ve seen on Earth. Some even had massive, shiny gems sewn into the fabric. You wondered how the humble Ponyville ponies could even afford outfits like these.

“Oh, such a gentleman!” She replies, with an indecipherable, almost mocking smirk. “Please, have a seat.”

You sit down at one of the booths, which was surprisingly soft and comfortable. “So what exactly is keeping a mare like you in a town like this?” You ask, trying to slowly work up the nerve to apprehend her. “You look like you’d be more at home in Canterlot.”

“Canterlot? Deary, no! I do not mean to talk down on others, but those Canterlot types are much too snobby for my tastes. They’d dismiss me as nouveau riche, anyway,” Rarity remarked, waving her hand dismissively in the air as if she was amused by the very concept. “But never mind the small talk! Let’s get down to business. I’ve never worked for a human before. What an amazing opportunity! I could gear you up with a denim jacket, accentuate that athletic physique-- or maybe just a hat would be more within your budget, perhaps? Cover up that mangy ‘do of yours-- no offence! I have a Panama in the back that would look just perfect-”

“So, miss Rarity… you are aware that there is a bounty on your head around these parts, correct?” You interrupted, and the room suddenly grew very tense and silent. You could hear a pin drop. You weren’t looking, but you heard her drop whatever she was doing immediately. Apparently, you struck a nerve.

“A bounty? Why, what kind of criminal do you take me for? I am a reputable member of this community!” Rarity replied immediately, sounding incredibly defensive.

“I’m not accusing you of anything. I’m just saying that the guards want me to bring you down to the town hall to ask you some questions,” You reassured her. There was a long, awkward pause.

“Well… alright. I’m sure this is just a big misunderstanding. I’ll come with you, and clear things up with the guards,” Rarity sighed, sounding like she’s calmed down. “But first, I was just about to have my afternoon tea. Would you like a cup?”
12532122.title: Rarity... the cunning rogue?

125321221.content:
“Yes, thank you,” You say with a polite nod. All you had to do now was bring her to the town hall, and you’ve made an easy 300 bits. She was even going to come willingly. Could it really be this easy? Could there be more to this situation than there seems? Before you could ponder this, however, Rarity poured you both a nice cup of tea, and sat down at the table, across from you.

“So, you’ve taken up bounty hunting?” Rarity made small talk, now sounding only half-interested. “An odd occupation for a wanderer.”

“Not really. It’s just, there’s posters plastered all around town,” You say, as you take a sip of your tea. You were immediately overcome by it’s flavor. You couldn’t distinguish what it was exactly, but it was the most delicious drink you’ve ever tasted. You assume it was made with ingredients exclusive to Equestria, as you’ve never tasted anything like it on Earth. “An awful fuss for a simple misunderstanding.”

“Indeed,” The mare sighed. “I suppose I should have figured that you weren’t a hunter, considering if you were, you’d probably be being a bit more… forceful.”

“Yes, they are brutes, aren’t they?” You chuckle, immediately taking another sip of your tea. It was delicious, but it was making you unusually drowsy. “I’ve had a few run-ins with them now and again while wandering. For vagrancy and the like.”

“Yes, some towns in Equestria definitely aren’t all too accepting of outsiders,” She shrugged. You noticed that, although Rarity also had a cup of tea, she didn’t seem to be drinking any. “But I’m sure you’ll fit right in here in Ponyville. We accept people of all shapes and sizes.”

“Yes, I’ve noticed,” You stutter. You were feeling incredibly drowsy now, as if you were on the verge of passing out. “Urgh… what kind of tea is this?”

She didn't answer, but she had grown a kind of smug smirk on her face. You've grown increasingly uncomfortable with this situation, and you decided you’ve had enough to drink. You stood up from your seat, only for your legs to give out beneath you. You fell against the smooth, marble floor of the boutique. You were so drowsy, now, that you could hardly move a muscle. What were you thinking? You should never have trusted her!

“What… did you...” Is all you manage to whimper, before consciousness fails you.

***

After feeling like you’ve slept for days, you finally come to. After the initial disorientation, you realize...
125321221.title: It's a trap!

choices: You find a way to escape.
1253212212.content:
When you regain consciousness, before you even opened your eyes, you were struck by a deeply nauseated feeling. You sit up grogilly, and take a look at your surroundings, not fully comprehending what you were seeing. It was a beautiful looking living room, but everything looked... gigantic. The fancy closet you were sitting by towered over you like a skyscraper. It was then that you realized you were sitting in a small bird cage that, at your size, was roughly the size of a studio apartment. You sit there for a moment, thinking you must just be hallucinating. But as you take in your surroundings, you realize it was all very, very real.

You try to stay calm. To occupy yourself, you grab the bars and push and pull on them with all your might. No give. You sigh, exasperated, as you sit against the wall of the cage and try to get your bearings. The memories of how you got here slowly came back to you, bit by bit. You curse yourself, silently. You should have never trusted her. Was there something in your tea that made you... shrink? You wouldn't be surprised. In a world of witchcraft and sorcery, you had come to expect things like this. Still, panic began to course through your veins, as it dawned on you how utterly helpless you were now. What did she have planned for you?

Eventually, you heard the sound of loud footsteps coming from the hallway, signaling the now massive-seeming mare to emerge into the bedroom. She had apparently just gotten out of the shower. You turn to her, furious, only for your guard to be lowered when she drops her towel and you lay eyes on her now titanic naked body. You thought you would have gotten used to this by now. These anthropomorphic ponies were naturally beautiful beyond belief; even the average, run-of-the-mill pony mare was a supermodel by human standards… yet Rarity still managed to be something else entirely. Her slick, wet fur pressing against her impeccable hourglass figure and firm breasts made your heart skip a beat. This combined with her size relative to you made her appear like nothing less than some sort of goddess.

She sat at a fancy purple dressing table and started to volumize and blow dry her mane. You had to clasp your hands over your ears, as the sound was deafening from your perspective. By chance, she glanced over to your cage, and saw you sitting there.

“Oh, you're finally awake! What a relief,” she smiled. “I was worried you'd never wake up.” She rolls the wheeled chair over, opening up the top of the cage and gently taking you in her hands, before rolling her chair back to her dressing table. She sets you down on the table as she brushes her mane in the mirror- the rest of her fur being too fine to need grooming.

“What did you do? What is this?” you call, loudly enough for her to hear.

“It's nothing personal. I just have a good operation going on here, and you ran in trying to mess it all up,” she chuckled. “So I needed to get you out of the way.”

“Get me out of the way? Are you going to kill me?”

“Heavens, no! I'm not going to hurt you! You're just going to be my little pet until I've made enough bits to move to the next hold. It shouldn't be long, at this point.” She reassures you. “That is, if you behave. If you don't, I might just keep you at this size. You look cuter this way, anyway.”

“You can't do this!” You yell.

“I'm not too happy that it came to this either, dear, but I'm afraid you forced my hand,” she explains, sounding remorseful. “But you will be treated well! You will not be considered a prisoner in my household, but a guest. An unwilling one, yes, but still!”

Her assurances understandably failed to satisfy you, and you grew increasingly frustrated. You didn't like feeling so helpless. But as a vagrant, you've spent your fair share of nights locked up in a cell before. At least this mare seemed a bit more amiable. You take a breath as you calm down, and decide to just roll with the punches. It's not like you had anything better to do, anyway.

“So what? You're just going to keep me in that cage over there for a week?” You murmur, pointing to the small bird cage.

“No, no! Well, maybe. I can carry you around with me as I work, if you want,” She offers, looking flushed. “But no, I can't let you just walk around freely, I'm afraid. You might run off, or get stepped on.”

Rarity stands from her seat, before pulling over a massive dresser and putting way too much thought into what she would wear for the day; deciding on an overly flashy dress, embellished with jewels, that only served to accentuate her curves and cleavage. Satisfied, she picked you up like a toy and placed you on her shoulder as she goes about her business for the day. “I really apologize for all this, dear. Really. I know this is a terrible introduction to Ponyville. I feel awful,” She whispers. “I just can't let anypony get in my way right now.”

“It's fine. I just never pegged you as the type of rogue work.”

“I'm not. But I need this to work out. I need the bits, not just for myself, but for my little sister,” she insists. “For her safety, and her future. I hope you understand.”

Being a pony, she was not only naturally attractive but also naturally adorable. You just couldn't stay mad at that face. Besides, this wouldn't be the first time something like this happened to you. This isn't nearly as bad as that time that that unicorn mage accidentally turned you into a newt for a few hours. You could handle this. “Alright, alright. I understand,” you shrug. “I should’ve figured this place was a front. A boutique in a small town where nobody ever wears any clothes?”

“No, no, this is a real boutique. Tailoring is my passion, after all. But it is a very small town, so customers are few and far between.” She declares as she walks down the ornate winding stairs, with you tagging along like a devil on her shoulder. “Moving up to Canterlot is going to remedy that.”

You were placed on a small wooden table with roughly the dignity of a child’s doll as Rarity began finishing the seams on a beautiful blue dress she had been tailoring. You sat there, staring at your surroundings as you try to figure out your strange situation, and listen idly to the quaint little tune Rarity hummed while she worked.

125322.content:
This new city was a lot to take in, to say the least. It was unique even compared to the rest of Equestria’s vibrant towns. You didn’t know where anything was, or where to even start. Overwhelmed, you decided to start with the basics. You were hungry. You’ve been on the train for a while, and you haven’t eaten anything. You wandered around until you found somewhere to eat-- ‘Sugarcube Corner’, the sign outside said. You found that it was basically empty inside, save for two mares sitting at one of the booths, and another, older mare standing at the counter, who introduced herself as ‘Mrs. Cake’. As you were about to walk out of the bakery with a paper bag of fresh pastries, however, someone stops you.

“Hey! Are you the human?” You to see one of the mares eating at the restaurant tapping on your shoulder, looking excited upon seeing your face. “It is you! Wow! We didn’t know you were going to stop by Ponyville. It’s so good to meet you in person!” The enthusiastic mare said as she grabbed your hand, shaking it wildly, before practically dragging you back to her booth. “Here, come sit with us!”

You sat down at a booth along with the two mares-- the enthusiastic one sitting next to you a mint green unicorn, and the mare sitting across from you a light yellow earth pony. It seems they both had already finished their meals, but were just hanging around the otherwise empty bakery, chatting. They were both topless, but at least they were wearing shorts. The former introduced herself as Lyra, and the latter Bon Bon. “So how long do you think you’re going to say out here, all the way in our little town of Ponyville?” Bon Bon asks.

“Actually, I think this is the town where I’m going to settle down. I’m getting tired of wandering, y’know?” You said, in between munching down on a donut.

“Really? Here? Great choice! I’m sure you’ll like it here,” Bon Bon says. “Do you have any friends in town? Any place to stay?”

“I was thinking of just finding a cheap hotel to stay in for a few weeks while I scrounge up enough bits to rent an apartment or something,” You said, in between munching down on a donut. “I still have a few hundred bits from some odd jobs I did in Baltimare.”

“You can stay with us, if you want!” Lyra suggests, enthusiastically.

“Umm… what?” You stutter, not expecting this.

“Yeah, what? We don’t even know him,” Bon Bon raises an eyebrow.

“Think about it! It’d be so cool to have a human stay with us for a while. We could be the first to show him around Ponyville, and tell him about Equestrian society, and in return, he could tell us all about his planet, and his kind’s powers, and we’d be the first to ever know! Before the biologists, before the historians… this is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity!” Lyra continues to frantically suggest. “We have that one spare bedroom that hasn’t been used in years. It’s only going to be for a couple of weeks, right? While you get on your feet?”

“Uh… yeah, I guess.” You shrug, while Bon Bon continues looking skeptical, before even she just shrugs her shoulders.

“Alright, sure. He can stay at our place for a while. But you’re the one that’s going to keep an eye on him,” Bon Bon shrugs as she relents, knowing that she’ll never hear the end of it if she doesn’t. Lyra’s eyes lit up.

“Oh, yes! Thank you, thank you, thank you! This is going to be awesome!” Lyra practically cheered.

“Now hold on, hold on. He hasn’t agreed to anything yet,” Bon Bon interrupts her. "So, ’Thomas’. What do you think?”
125322.title: Enthusiastic Acquaintances

Jake awoke with a yawn in his tiny bed. Well, it was perfectly suited to his size, but it was tiny relative to his pony masters. Upon his arrival in this world, Jake was almost immediately captured and sent to a pet store. Here, humans were viewed as too weak to look after themselves, and so the ponies had graciously offered to look after them. It was treated as a great kindness, and even viewed that way by most of the native humans who were utterly devoted to their pony masters, not unlike dogs. Jake had been reluctant in the beginning, viewing this treatment as humiliating and dehumanizing. But, with time, has begrudgingly come to accept that ponies are pretty nice to their human pets, at least for the most part.

Case in point, after Jake finished musing over his place in the world, he pushed soft covers off of his naked form. Ponies were mostly nudist, only wearing clothes for special occasions, and so saw no reason to dress up their pets; well, except to show off. Jake stretched and made the short trek over to the ‘wash room’, a closed off area with a fully functioning sink and toilet. With his business done, he returned to the main area of his enclosure. It was a terrarium specially designed for humans with transparent plastic walls, running water, temperature control, an alarm system, and many other amenities for a pet human. At times it was still hard not to view this place as a prison, but at least it was a cozy one.

Then came a stirring as Jake looked out onto the room of his owner and towards their bed. His master was waking up and would no doubt begin the day by greeting their pet. Who is Jake’s owner?

Someone in Ponyville or Canterlot?

15332.content:
A shadow emerges from the fog around the docks of Horseshoe Bay; a titanic ship, its bow splitting the sea in two. The passengers of the ship crowd onto the deck, cheering as the great metropolis comes into view. The trip to Baltimare had been long and hard, the passengers having spent weeks confined in tiny cabins, but it was worth it. Baltimare was known as a city of opportunity; where even the least fortunate of ponies can come and eke out a new life for themselves. As the ship landed, many of the town’s citizens came down to the docks to welcome the new arrivals; ponies who may one day be their friends or coworkers. For the poor immigrants from the far south, it was just the kind of paradise they imagined. They came in couples or families, having furniture hauled in by workers and carrying suitcases stuffed with money and clothing. And somewhere, lost among the crowd, was a quiet young mare carrying nothing but a cello.

The mare slipped away from the crowd, not wanting to get caught up in the arrival celebration. She clutches her huge cello case as she winds through the crowd, trying not to make eye contact with the locals. She almost feels unworthy to be among them; embarrassed to be seen in public during the lowest point of her life. She had to get away from her hometown, somehow, before it all ended up killing her. She spent most of her bits buying a boat ticket that would take her as far away as possible. Everything and everyone she ever knew or loved, she had to leave behind. Her cello case was now her only real possession in the world.

But Baltimare was a city of opportunity. Thousands of down-on-their-luck ponies like her came here every year, or so the brochure claims. As she steps onto the bustling city streets, she thinks, surely this is her second chance? Surely, this is her chance to finally live the life she’s always dreamed of?

She sighed. Here’s hoping she doesn’t screw everything up this time.

***
A few days later…


You sat staring at your heels, as water runs down your bare body. You shiver frightfully, clutching yourself futilely in the cold. You sat beneath a shred of cardboard in an alleyway, trying to shield yourself from the rain. Days ago, you had woken up in a strange land called Equestria, a fantasy world with a number of odd quirks. The people looked slightly different than normal, complete with tails, snouts and fur, and called themselves ‘ponies’. Despite these odd features, they all seem to be preternaturally attractive, the average ‘mare’ being a supermodel by human standards, which is further exacerbated by their penchant for walking around half-naked. But all of that isn’t even the worst part; when you came to this world, you were shrunken to 4 inches in height! You considered yourself a laid-back kind of guy, but for your first couple of days in Equestria, you had been freaking out non-stop. You had always had a bit of phobia for things that were much larger than yourself, and these ‘ponies’ were over fifteen times your size!

The first pony you showed yourself to was a young mare that walked by the alleyway you lived in often. You had overheard her conversations, and found that she sounded nice. Maybe you had been worrying over nothing, you thought to yourself. Maybe these ponies really are nothing to be afraid of. So yesterday, you finally worked up the courage to step out and try to get her attention. But when she laid eyes upon you, she immediately let out a piercing squeal. “Eek! A bug!” she yelled, immediately pulling her foot up in the air. Before you could even register what was happening, you looked up to see her giant foot descending upon you!

“No, no, wait!” You cried, as you jumped out of the way, only narrowly escaping being crushed under the mare’s foot. You quickly ran back to your alleyway and hid, almost hyperventilating. That had been the scariest moment in your entire life! From then on, you had been particularly skittish… but things weren’t working out very well. Your reduced size resulted in a reduced need for food, but you were still severely malnourished. Your clothes hadn’t shrunk with you, so you had been completely naked in the cold of autumn. You didn’t know how much longer you could go on like this.

Meanwhile, the grey young mare who played the cello walked down the sidewalk in the rain, running an errand for her lord. She had immediately landed a job as a maidservant for a wealthy hierophant, who paid her just enough for her to survive on. The job was a bit soul-rending, especially because her real dream was to make money playing her cello, but she assured herself that it was only temporary. Besides, it felt good to finally feel self-reliant. As she walked, she caught a glimpse of something unusual out of the corner of her eye. She turned, to see a tiny creature squatting in an alleyway. At first, she thought it was some kind of insect, but quickly realized it was unlike any insect she had ever seen. “Hm?” she vocalized, tilting her head curiously. This gets the critter’s attention, and it quickly skitters away and hides. But the mare was too curious to simply let it go.

She followed the critter curiously down the alleyway, trying to show that she was friendly and meant no harm. Eventually, they reached a dead end, and the mare knelt down and finally got a good look at the strange creature. It was the strangest animal she had ever seen! It looked like some kind of furless pony, about the size of a crayon. She marveled at the strange creature, until she realized that it was obvious afraid. “Hey there, little guy,” she greeted in a calm tone, trying to show that she wasn’t a threat.

While this may have been fun from the mare’s perspective, from your point of view, this chase had been terrifying! You had darted down the alleyway as fast as you could when the mare spotted you, but you couldn’t possibly outrun the massive giantess. Eventually, you had run into a dead end, and simply cowered in fear, expecting her to crush you into the ground. To your surprise, instead, the mare only calmly greeted you, in an almost motherly tone of voice. You looked up at her, apprehensively. This was the first time you’ve ever seen a pony up close. She had a coat of grey fur that was as smooth as silk, a silver mane, and wore nothing but a pair of white panties. But the first thing your eyes were brought to were her bare breasts, which hovered inches away from your face. Even from an average perspective, they were large and pillowy; by from your shrunken perspective, they were humongous! They were almost bigger than you were! But you averted your gaze, trying not to anger her. “H-h-hello,” You stutter in response, afraid that any wrong word may be your last.

“Oh! So you can talk? I’ve never seen a critter like you before,” she smiled. “What kind of animal are you?”

“I-I’m a human, I guess?” You say, nervously.

“Why, I’ve never heard of 'humans',” she says, intrigued. She had met other bipedal, talking animals, like cows and horses, but she had never met one that was so tiny. “Are humans native to Baltimare?”

You didn’t want to lie to her, but you figured if you told her the truth about where you came from, she might freak out. “Uh… yeah, I was born in Baltimare. In a human village.”

“Well, that explains it then! Sorry, I’m new to this city,” she said, standing tall and folding her arms, looking genuinely exciting to be meeting a new creature. “I’m Octavia. What’s your name, little guy?”

“Uh… Thomas.”

“Enchanté,” she greets, but her curiosity continues. “Well, what happened to your village?”

“Someone came and stepped on them all,” you make up a fake story on the spot, trying to make her feel sympathy for you. “I was the only one that got away.”

Her smile immediately faded, and she reeled back and gasped at your story, startling you. You had expected to garner some sympathy, but you didn’t expect her reaction to be that extreme! “Oh! That’s horrible!” she says, looking heartbroken. “Who could do such a thing? And now you’re just here, alone, in the rain?” You nod, giving her the saddest look you could manage. You expected that ponies would just try to squish you, but so far, this mare seemed genuinely kind. She thought for a moment, before her warm smile returns. “Tell you what! You can live with me for a little while, until we find you a new human village,” she offers. “Beats sleeping in the rain, right?” You were immediately taken aback. You hadn’t anticipated this. You were about to decline, but your grumbling stomach reminded you of your predicament. You didn’t think you could survive much longer on your own at this size. You still didn’t fully trust this mare, but she may be your best bet.

155122.content:
So far, not so different from home, Tom could see when he stepped out of the train station and laid foot on Canterlot's cobblestone path for the first time. Of course, that thought didn't keep him from almost tripped a step or two as he rose his head to took in the ornate rooftops of the country's capital, much like any other person stepping in from the outside.

The towering buildings all around him were all made from varying shades of the purest of marble marble, each one like a miniature castle that was shielded by weathered purple shingles and embroidered with shimmering gold. Even the air felt expensive as he took in a long, relishing breath; it felt filtered, sort of like how bottled water tasted. He took the next step, then kept on going, his head turning every which way as he took in the lore of one of the most expensive cities to ever exist on the planet, the one that he'd be one of the absolute rare few to call his home.

Looks like something out of a satire... Tom thought wistfully. Something that a poor artists would draw up to poke fun at the upper 1%: just ponies wearing waistcoats, top hats, dresses, and ridiculously pampered hairstyles, all pointing their noses at the sky as they droned on in jargon that he could vaguely tell was about some big business talk or popular socialite affairs. He was quick to feel out of place from all the noble men, having decided on a plaid shirt, black jeans, and a skipped shaving job to get ready for the day, and many of the ponies actually gave a double take as they noticed him sightsee their way, eyeing him like he was a dirty smudge on a marble countertop.

Then again, it was probably the size difference. Definitely, to be realistic.

Again, like something out of some ridiculous political cartoon, Tom only stood tall enough to stand at eye level with the citizens' waists, providing him with plenty of bare butts to drink in. Tons of them, and literally so, always quaking about as their owners weight sent faint tremors through the ground beneath their hoofsteps, some so welled that they could've plugged up a garage door. No matter where he was, Tom couldn't go ten feet without hearing some rampant chewing nearby, even if he wasn't walking near any of the overstuffed restaurants and cafes infesting the city, with ponies walking around carrying around enough food to serve an entire party a three course meal, eating with forks and napkins like they were at the dining table. They were all clean and well groomed, Tom was quite thankful form, but he found himself pulling his arms in along his sides as he walked between some of the fattest ponies he'd never imagined being as big as they were.

All around him, there wasn't a stomach that didn't reach the ground, hanging in front of its owner like overblown weather balloons that were all plush with fur and paunch, often looking like they were ready to pop with a red burn forming at the front as the pony stuffed him or herself to their absolute limit. Whether it was just a popular sense of fashion, or because there simply wasn't enough cloth in the world left over to completely cover them up, he couldn't tell, but there wasn't a single pony in sight who wore a pair of pants, with most of their semi or bare naked bodies drooping down far enough to effectively censor out their genitals, not that it made Tom's blush soften out any more.

He struggled to keep his mind focus over the heat burning in his mind, and tapped a mare on the shoulder. "Excuse me, miss?"

"Hm?" The mare glanced over, then scuttled around to face him, dragging her stomach around over the brick ground and leaning down enough to see him over its massive curve, smiling politely. "Yes, dear?"

He pulled a slip of paper from his pocket, handing it to her. "Would you happen to know which way I could find this address?"

She looked over the area written down, turned her eyes up in thought, then pointed down a nearby street. "Just go down that way, then turn right down the first block. You should easily see it from there!"

"Thank you!" He nodded back, hoisting his bags up again and navigating around the bulbous population towards his location, the spot that would represent the rest of his life.

1551223.content:
The calming air the decorative trees on both sides of the entry road breathed , the scent of newly bloomed flowers in the nearby Sculpture Garden, the sound of the Royal Guards trotting along the grounds...all of these things thrilled Tom as he made his way to Canterlot Castle, the seat of government for the Royal Diarchy of Equestria, the official residence of the Princess Celestia and Luna, and most importantly his new workplace and home.

The palace was so awesome and significant that it made the rest of Canterlot look like a wooden shanty town. The palace of polished white marble and ivory towers went up so high it looked as if it was trying to pierce the sky. Tom smiled and quickened his pace towards the castle proper.

The road to this new Canterlot life had not been an easy one. Cooking has always been Tom’s number one passion, and paid for his skill and experience with his own sweat and tears. Ever since he was a little kid, he was enamored by the high life of Canterlot, and he dreamed of getting to cook for the Royal Princesses. Top of his class at Culinary School, praised in magazines and newspapers for his innovative recipes and approach to cooking, he had won the attention of not only Canterlot’s high society, but Celestia and Luna themselves. It was them that asked for Tom to be the head chef, and he graciously accepted. His hard work had finally paid off. He had gotten his dream job.
