“Shhhh…” Tom’s Goddess silenced the muffled voice underneath her tons of blubber. “It’s okay, my little human. You’ve been doing so well, don’t stop the show just yet. Five more measly minutes, that’s all...and if you make it that long, I’ll give you a reward~”

Tom obeyed Celestia and bit down on his lower lip hard, almost enough to draw blood. The sensations, the agony, the raw joy was too much to take in. But...It was his first day on the job.Is that how he wanted to put himself forward to his boss, his princess? No, he would grin like the dopey chef he was and keep it in, for his job...and for her.

After five agonizing minutes that felt more like hours of this blue balling, Tom had reached his absolute limit. With total absence of any dignity and/or shame, Tom let out a lion’s roar into fuzzy fat as he released into his Princess. Celestia grinned harder then she had ever done in decades as her human reached his finale. With a contented sigh, she rolled over on her bed, giving Tom some much needed fresh air.

“My my…” Celestia observed Tom’s naked form gasp for breath as he panted in his own sweat. “You should be proud of yourself, Tom. Not many last that long, you know.”

“Thank...you…” Tam wheezed, choosing his words carefully during exhales as he felt the life giving air rush into his rapidly re-inflating lungs. “That means...a lot...since it...was my first.”

Celestia eyes widened a little in shock, but her smile didn't diminish in the slightest. “Well, now you’re just showing off.” She giggled, earning a tired chortle from her chef. “Now...I did promise a reward, didn't I?”

Tom didn't have the strength to be surprised when he felt Celestia leviatet his body towards her face. She was back to her old height, big enough for his body to be saely perched on the top of her chest. He did, however, have the strength to let out a high pitched squeal as he felt something lukewarm and gooey lap over his tired muscle.

“Mmmmm…” Celestia pured, relishing in the taste. “I wouldn't expect anything less from Equestria’s best cook.” Tom just layed there, arms spread out on either side of him, his body sinking into the milk sloshing orbs as his new boss cleaned him off. All the while he had a smile on his face that made him look like he was the luckiest human in the world, which may just be true.

Celestia gave Tom one last, teasing lick and let her pink tongue slurp back into her mouth. She gave out an admittedly cute yawn and leaned back into her bed. “When you wake up, I expect you to make me a dinner that will blow me away, understand? Not that you haven’t already.”

Tom nodded, his smile still plastered to his face. With an amused giggle, Celestia effortlessly pushed her human with her right index finger down the impossibly soft crevice of her chest. In an instant he was engulfed in a world of comfort, two milk filled pillows squishing him to sleep on either side of his tired body.

He couldn’t stay awake even if he tried.

15512233.content:
“On-hon hon! Bounjour, mon petite croissant!” Came the most non-French French accent Thom had ever heard.

It’s not to say Thom expected an easy start: any experience he knew of cooking would be just tying his shoelaces for the long, long rip he was in for just to get started on catering to the likes of Canterlot’s elite, so he’d long steeled himself for the full brunt of the job to impact him like a tidal wave, ready for it to submerge him right when he was packing his socks that very morning. Snooty teachers chastising him for the most basic of mistakes, angry customers, maybe a few rounds of initiation from his neighbors.

Thom mentally scolded himself for not putting ‘greeted by the chaos god’ on his list.

Another mix of fake-French chortling and utterings of ‘croissant’ and ‘fromage’ rang out from a multicolored blob from the end of the room past its staircase, spilling from a white chef’s costume that adhered to it’s owners circumference and various rolls akin to how a wetsuit would. It was about twenty-something times as much Discord as Thom expected him to be, history having written him so often as some skinny, agile buffoon who could swim though the air like some eel in water, but here before Thom now, he possessed an immensity that gave his noodle-like form much more definition.

Defined, that is, by canyon-sized dimples in the elbows of bingo wings hanging off his shoulders with the weight of train cars, a set of bitch-tits that Celestia’s own lardiness would desire to own, capping a mammoth of a belly whose all-encompassing expanse proceeded his entire figure in a spheric landmass of brown engulfing part of the staircase, blemished by copious rolls along its diameter and creases where its mass doubled in on its self, and an outright titan of an ass sagging out from either side of him, one that no sexuality could prevent any gender from staring at for uncomfortable lengths of time. Even his tail was downright fat, springing out from his butt crack in a red, blobby appendage that made wearing pants an impossibility for him.

Discord descended the stairway whilst twiddling the end of a fake moustache adhered to his upper lip, footfalls earning a frightening amount of the sounds of flexing metal and bending wood; yet another reminder of how un-Discord his actions and presence were expected. “Tu es, as they say, monsier Thomas? Je suis monsier not-Discord, le big-man chef, as your freedom-loving people would say!” He affirmed, pointing to a name tag on his suit with the same moniker written.

“Okay, I’m not even French, and I’m getting really offended right now.”

Letting out another chuckle, Discord reached the bottom of the staircase and came up to his side, his nubby fingers grabbing Thom’s shoulder and pulling him into an uncomfortable amount of contact with Discord’s hip, their size difference equating it to being pulled into a bear-hug by one of Canterlot’s biggest residents. “On-hon-hon, monsier, you can have biggest assurances that the boundaries between my glorious country and yours shall not be any of a hindrance as you are taught to turn yeast and fromage into ART!” He extended an arm and opened a hand to the air. “In weals, you will have learned to spawn flying cupcakes! Eclairs that do taxes! Cakes with legs, smart enough to legally be your own children! EVERYTHING!” He listed off, conjuring those insane descriptions to materialize onto his palm and traverse down his arm, then march right into their doom as he opened his maw for them to enter and be swallowed whole.

With each little addition of weight to enter his mall, Thom could feel his fleshy captor widen out and absorb more of his scrawny figure, prompting a round of kicking and muffled screaming against his reptilian leg.

“But, how you say, we shall start off with le baby steps. To learn the space, as you will. Avec moi?”

Freedom for Thom when Discord’s grip loosened to let him unceremoniously fall to the floor, the draconequus parading for the other room in anticipation. Seeing his big butt jiggle and sway to exit the room, Thom took only three second to abandon his dreams and walked the other way to get a new job and rethink his life...only for turning around to change his entire surroundings without a burst of magic or energy to signal the shift. When his arms were once free, he was bounded by a stretched surface tautly strapping him into something soft...something soft and warm, and mired by a damp layer that saturated into his best clothes.

Looking backwards, Thom found himself amongst the three to five chins trapped in Discord’s collar, whose mismatched eyes observed his student’s horrified look with fondness.

“Le scenic view, as they speak.” He assured him. “Shall we, as they say, begin?”

155131.title: Crystal Empire?

1551312.content:
Thomas Knox the human, better known as Tom by his family, better known as 829-L by his masters, awaited outside the great, heavy, wooden doors that led to the throne room of the Crystal Palace. He was anxious, and rightly so, as he wiped off beads of fearful sweat away from his forehead. Today was objectively one of the most important in his entire life: the day he was assigned under King Sombra’s ownership.

Tom, like the rest of his family and most everyone else living in the Crystal Empire, was a slave. The official term is ‘Indentured Citizen’, a model of law where everyone must pay their dues to the government for providing police, education, etc., by offering themselves to civil service. The curious thing is that Sombra doesn't ‘force’ people to become slaves to his glory, but instead encourages it by setting down rules and regulations so it seems like a better alternative to freedom.

Tom signed his first Servitude Contract - which included the duration of his service, the conditions he would work in, and the nature of what was required of him - when he was old enough to be called an adult in the eyes of society. To get a job in the empire, you had to be a slave. If you’re lifelong dream was to become a police officer, a doctor, or a teacher, you had to legally sign away your agency to the administration of King Sombra.

Sombra, despite being an absolute monarch who has enslaved generations of untold humans and ponies, was actually not as bad as one would think. Anymore. He’s not as bad anymore. In the past, sure, he showed all the signs of a sinister, evil tyrant who got off watching others under him suffer. But as years went by, the whole evil villain dictator schtick got old, and it turned out that treating the people that served for his rule better made productivity go up.

The people under Sombra’s rule aren’t stupid, they know that Sombra is a dictator. But it wasn't as if they could just up and leave, the royal guard saw fit to that. And the people in the past that led rebellions against him weren't ever seen from again. The Indentured Servitude Oversight Committee made sure that the people were treated well enough, that productivity was up, and that people aren't getting screwed over in their contracts.

Thomas Knox was not taken from his family home, kicking and screaming to the Crystal Place for his new ‘job’. No, he ASKED for it. Why? Even if it meant being a chew toy for the bored king, fulfilling Sombra’s contract is guaranteed lifelong happiness. With being his slave on your resume, you can haggle every contract for the rest of your life down to nothing. It was like a lottery of sorts, hundreds of people would put in applications every year to get the chance to be Sombra’s servant, and Tom was the first one to win in a very long time. He didn't expect to win, really. He mailed in his application with the confidence of scratching of the winning numbers of a five bit lottery card.

So when a throng of sharply dressed guards knocked on Tom’s door to escort him in an armored limousine ot the massive spiraling tower in the heart of the kingdom, he was understandably nervous and excited at the same time.

“829-L.” A stiff looking guard called for Tom’s attention as he came through the heavy doors. “Your presence is requested.”

Tom bristled and adjusted his clothes one last time before following the guard into the throne room. His palms were sweaty, his hair was slick, and his insides had more butterflies than a lepidopterarium, but underneath all of that, he was ready. Or at least he thought he was.

The moment Tom entered the throne room with the guard, he saw Sombra at the far end of the room sitting on his throne. But it wasn't as if he had to look hard when he took up a quarter of the room with his great, expansive body alone. The dark monarch had certainly filled out since he took over the empire so many years ago, eating whatever and whoever he pleased with a massive appetite for food aplenty. He gained pound after pound, not that he minded one bit mind you. If anything, the gain in blubber in his body, focused on his gargantuan, sloshy belly that crashed into the marble floor and his throne enveloping rump, seemed to make him even more passionate about his consumption.

His body wobbled with every breath he took as he snored away, asleep in his own throne. Sombra, content with how he presented himself to his subjects, felt now need to torture his lower body with prisons of cloth, preferring to go nude save for his velvet cape, some mail armor that only barely covered his chest, and a tiny crown perched atop his flowing black mane.

“Your Majesty!” The guard cried with a loud tap of his ceremonial sword on the marble floor. Sombra awoke from his slumber with a loud snort and a jolt, eyes fluttering as he yawned and stretched his bloated arms over his head.

“You better have a pretty damn good reason to…” Sombra grumbled darkly, having his sleep rudely stolen from him. He stopped his low mutterings as he laid his gaze on the figity human next to his guard's side, blushing with his head cast to the floor. Tom raised his head to meet his king’s gaze, and was met with...

155132.content:
Cloudsdale.

The moving city located high above the clouds, the epicenter of all weather phenomena in Equestria, and the home to the Wonderbolt Squad. Curiously enough, despite the suffix ‘dale’ being in the name, the town is not settled in a valley, but nobody ever pays attention to that. Instead, they pay attention to the beautiful Greek style buildings and architecture, with their eye-catching Pegasi motifs and dazzling shades of white.

To a lot of people, both Pony and Human alike, Cloudsdale offers an escape. High above the skies and far from Equestria Proper, the city is seen as a second chance at life, an opportunity to begin again. Failed artists whose work was seen as too new or suffering from ‘an absence of cultivated taste’ would find refuge in airy fields where they work could flourish without hindrance. Pegasi who go about wandering through their lives can find new purpose in the Wonderbolts, where one could find comradery and newfound friendship between squaddies.

The only problem is if you’re not a Pegasus, or a Dragon or Griffin, than getting to Cloudsdale can be...expensive. The city rarely ever leaves it’s position in the stratosphere, and will only dock and let others come on if there was a special event happening, or someone pays an ascension fee with a lot of digits in it. But as expensive as it is, people will stay pay, and Cloudsdale stays in the Black,

This is the story of Tom, a human, who has paid the exorbitant price for Cloudsdale to fly low enough for him to step on. The last couple of years for him have been...tough to say the least. He had been working as a cashier at a fast food joint ever since he was seventeen. But it was supposed to be a temporary gig until he could find work after college. Well, college came and went, but apparently he picked the worst possible degree because nobody would hire him. As of late, he’s become cynical, pessimistic, and kind of insufferable to his coworkers.

But that was all going to change. After years of living paycheck to paycheck, thrift shopping, and an admittedly appealing diet of cheap food from where he worked, he had finally made enough money to begin again in Cloudsdale. For the first time in a very, VERY long time...Tom felt a twinge of hope for his future.

As he took his first steps onto the airy, yet still solid ground of the great city, Tom set out with a spring in his step towards...
155132.title: Cloudsdale?

1551321.content:
“So, Tom,” Spitfire lead on, her voice distant as she scribbled something on her clipboard that he could tell was far higher-up work Tham his application. “Before we’re in my office, there's something I've got to get squared away first... was there any specific reason why the Wonderbolts caught your attention? All the way from here to Baltimare, specifically?"

Any first attempt at matching his boss’ actions, currently those of just trying to catch up with her saw him stumbling about and tripping over his own feet in a way that seemed insultingly symbolic. Not that Tom wasn’t eager for the job; anything could fit over flipping burgers at one of the greasiest cities in Equestria, but trying to keep up with the quakes that resounded of his oversized boss made from trundling along the already bouncy cloud-floors seem like part of the job itself.

All the more a reason…no, excuse to stall in giving an answer, scared to choose between pathetic truths or obvious lies.

“The…” He began, thinking at a rate of one word at a time. “The culture. Yeah, I’ve…been a big…uh…connoseiur of Cloudsdale culture, and…the…the Wonderbolts are at the top of all that. Yeah…you know?”

“Mm-hmm.” She grunted in the tone that just saying ‘no’ couldn’t match.

For Tom, standing next to Spitfire and mentally linking her to all the claims of what an acrobatic, flexible, and outright powerful mare was felt akin to standing on one end of a massive canyon whilst scrutinizing a bird perched on the other. Okay, perhaps “powerful” wasn’t such an absurd claim; somewhere beneath all that buttery exterior, he could sense the ghost of a behemothic framework of muscle comparable in size to a king size mattress, further decorated by thick, bulky thigh muscles still fit enough to run a few miles every morning, throbbing biceps that frequently ballooned in size, even with the most subtle of movements, and, most notably, just an unflinching immunity to her indomitable bulk, her footsteps rattling around the hallway’s walls and innards without making her breathing flex in volume.

Yes, he didn't have to be creative to see Spitfire crushing his bones or yanking his head off with ease...even if the grand armada of musculature inside of her was shrouded beneath piling layers of digested lard and grease that weren’t under a foot thick in the healthier regions, any semblance of definition in her arms reduced to the vaguest outlines within grossly swollen limbs choked by the sleeves of her work shirt (sleeves already big enough to fit an obese man’s waist,) and roll-ridden balloons of calves supporting thighs that meshed together in a gargantuan, zeppelin-like ass whose berth surpassed that of her looming nine-foot build.

All of which was barricaded down in front by an eight-foot thick barrier of adipose that consisted her stomach, a gargantuan mass protruding from her torso with only enough paunch and give for it to cascade completely past her legs and weigh down on several feet of floor beyond her hooves, but structured with a dense core of muscle that caused it to pounce outwards in a taut orb, supplying it with a plush, yet rubbery surface that could ricochet any punch or kick without receiving any bruising, probably enough to dislocate the arm of any poor sap who’d try in the first place.

…and all of it was naked. Spitfire was at least modest enough to wear panties, but at her size it only covered as much as a line of Sharpie drawn around her hips. Her commander’s jacket carried enough pride that her nipples weren’t open to the air, either, but considering the sheer tonnage that her breasts carried, two severely overgrown orbs strangling the very front buttons while hugging round the lapels like a pair of muffin tops…it didn’t stop Tom from seeing the most yellow he'd ever seen at once in his own life.

“Considering that, however,” She affirmed, not looking aside as the face of her stomach pushed aside the doors to her office, with Tom darting into action to step out of reach from her footfalls. “Lets say that tonight…no, after this interview, I said you had a job. What point do you go from, then? Cleaning? Strategy? Grooming?”

“W-Whatever you’re willing to teach me, miss. What’s available right now, for instance?”

“The issue’s not what’s available, Mister Knox.” She threw back, casting eyes on him that, regardless of the football-sized cheeks hanging on her face, scanned him like the sights of two guns sending beams on his forehead. “The issue…at least, I hope it’s not an issue, is what’s a place in the Wonderbolts for a human straight out of Baltimare?”

“W-W-Well…I…” It’s not that he didn’t expect any judgement on the job…at least, not before the job. “I…I may be a human, but…”

…and Tom became one of the rare people to make Spitfire break face, her eyes widening in realization. “Oh! Mister Knox, I didn’t mean that in regards to you being a human! I apologize!”

“Oh!” He exclaimed, his relief masking his embarrassment. “Heh…thank you commander.”

“Yes, I meant in regards to a human in the fast food industry.” She continued, flawlessly transitioning from that last thought. “I’m looking at your employment history, and I can’t help but notice something about you seems a bit too…ambitious.”

“Ambitious?”

“Stop n’ Burger…” She read from his forms, pointing at the first spot in his record. “Sandy’s…The Taco Bowl…” She continued, pointing further down on the list with each name. “Fast food…fast food…fast food…” Then her finger passed the bottom of the list, her finger pointing down at her own desk. “…The Wonderbolts?”

“Yes?”

“The Wonderbolts, some of the most elite, highly trained athletes…no, military in all of Equestria, right after barely an adulthood of part-time work?”

“Er…I…” Tom could feel ten or so minutes crumble from the interview, and still without a ‘yes’ in sight. “Just…that next step in life, you know?”

“Not so much a step as ‘launched from a cannon.’” She surmised.

“Well, if…if I can ask, where could I start here?”

1551321.title: ...being the first Human in the Wonderbolts!

choices: Some other Pony want’s help too
15513212.content:
Tom could not tell whether or not his new job in the Wonderbolts was an upgrade or a downgrade. Granted, It was not food related, and he was certainly grateful for that, having spent enough time around greasy, fattening treats to last a lifetime. And he knew that getting a job itself would have been a challenge with his resume, and passing spitfire’s interview was worthy of a pat on the back.

But being assigned as a glorified shower attendant was certainly not what Tom expected when he deposited his entire life savings to Cloudsdale’s treasury just to let him on. It was certainly a step in the right direction towards a potential future in Equestria’s elite military, however, he was just hoping that first step would not require him to swallow his pride like he had been doing in Baltimare.

As the Wonderbolt’s ‘Main Scrubber’, Tom was in charge of making sure Cloudsdale’s elite were sparkling clean. Mainly, that detailed turning on and off the hot water, making sure that the soap was stocked, cleaning the towels after use, and taking care of the shower cleanliness itself. On paper, his main job was actually very removed from the situation, just making sure that the squadies were able to clean themselves. And if that was the case, he may have been a little less cynical about it.

...but realistically, as explained by Spitfire and Tom’s new boss, despite how athletic and musclebound they were under all of their layers of fat, the Pegasi in the Wonderbolts had ‘trouble’ getting to their hard to reach areas with all of their blubber in the way, and sometimes they would need help. ‘Help’ is a phrase in which here means getting a bath sponge with a load of soap on it and scrubbing the dirt and grime from their nether regions.

Tom’s only consolation was that only the male squaddies could request that of him. The ladies had trouble sometimes too, but they had their own scrubbers that were much more comfortable around their feminine anatomy. He sighed heavily as he looked at his reflection in one of the shower mirrors. Having a suit devoid of grease stains provided to him was nice, but did they really have to add salt to the wound by having him wear a bow tie? It didn’t scream formality and professionalism as it did submission.

“Alright Squaddies, that was some real nice flying you did put they're, all of you should be proud of yourselves. Go on, get cleaned up and take a load off for the rest of the day, you earned it!” Tom heard the muffled voice of what he assumed was a regiment commander outside the tiled walls of the room. A lone bead of sweat ran down his neck as he heard their hoof steps waddle towards where he was. The first day, the first shift. He better make a good impression.

Tom took his spot at attendant’s post in the middle of the room where he could survey all of the shower. The ponies in their barley fitting uniforms came in like a herd of elephants, but payed him no mind as they walked past his post and immediately began stripping down to wash off. Thankfully, all them appeared to be fully capable of cleaning themselves, and he had already made sure the soap and towels were ready, so all he really had to do was open a hatch, turn a dial, and flip a switch to turn on the water.

The room was soon abuz with the Pegasi chatting amongst themselves as they made sure their fur was glossy and clean. The smell of hard earned misled quickly faded away and shampoo and body conditioner took it’s place. Tom allowed himself to smile a tad as he heard the cliched towel whip on someone’s ass and a shout in response. So far, nothing seemed to be going wrong…

But than Tom felt the airy ground beneath him bounce as heavy hoof steps trudged slowly through the building. They were heavy, heavier than Spitfire’s, and Tom had to grasp onto something just to stay upright. After a couple more of those miniature earthquakes, the source revealed itself.

The regiment’s commander, Soarin as it said in his name tag, came into the shower after momentarily getting stuck in the doorway specifically designed to accommodate his size. He had emerald eyes, a dark blue mane, and a pale cornflower coat, but all Tom could pay attention to was his mountainous dome of a gut that quivered with every step, his thunder thighs that flared out like a rising Phoenix, and barely clothed moobs that could put most women to shame.

Soarin has a Jolly, kind smile as he looked out to his fellow Pegasi, Tom being hidden from his sight under the horizon of his gut. The other ponies gave a cheer and a hearty welcome to their commander as he walked by to one of the showers that was built just for ponies his size. He seemed to be a Father to his men, and more of a friend than a superior to the troops. He stripped out of his uniform that wasent doing anything to hide his fat body from the world in the first place, and began to clean himself off.

At first, Tom had hoped that since Soarin hadn’t noticed him, he wouldn’t have to provide any of his additional ‘services’. But just when he thought he was in the clear, some idiot ruined it. “Hey commander, look! We got a scrubber now!” One Pegasus addressed to Soarin while he pointed to Tom, making him blush under the attention. “Great news for you, Huh, ya fat piggy!”

Tom didn’t want to think it, but the cornflower colored commander truly did have a birth longer than his limbs. His bloated arms only reached halfway down to his gargantuan stomach, and they were having trouble reaching over it’s massive circumference. Soarin looked perplexed, having not seen anyone at the post, but than backed up to see a human hidden in plain sight at the foot of the room’s pillar.

He gave Tom an awkward smile as a little color rose to his lard-laden cheeks. “Uhh...do you mind if...I could get some ‘help’ over here?”
15513212.title: Shower Helper

155132122.content:
No excuses, under any circumstance. Spitfire's voice warned when the temptation to make one came to fruition. EVER.

Wordlessly staring up at the obese commander, Tom craned his head down to align his gaze with his stomach, but shut his eyes, then wracked his brain for all his grossest memories of the fast-food life; all the bugs he saw skittering around when he was cleaning late at night, the sweat-stained bits dozens of mares fished from their cleavages to pay with, or the time a stallion who couldn't have had less than ten bowel conditions used the bathroom one night and didn't flush...then he opened his eyes, estimating where on Soarin's relatively showered exterior the point of no return would be.

Only when a few of the other Wonderbolts began to snicker at the stretched pause, and Soarin was forced to nervously join in, was when Tom nodded his head. "Lift it up."

Glancing down at his leviathan of a stomach in uncertainty, Soarin' stooped down and grabbed as big of armfuls of the colossal, mushy orb as they could carry and guided it upwards with a strength to rival Spitfire's, leaving in its place a deep, perfectly round basin of flattened cloud in the floor that spread out seventeen feet in diameter.

With his superior's muzzle wrapped up in a near crimson under the strain, Tom bit his lip, took one last inhale of air that wasn't damp with musk...and stomped over to Soarin before crouching down to crawl underneath his belly, which hovered only four feet above the ground whilst casting a shadow on the shivering human as dark as nighttime. It was probably from being an athlete that spared Tom of any of the grease-streaked cellulite some of his former customers were covered with, but that didn't prevent copious patches of dirt and grass stains from being painted around the vast underside of Soarin's stomach...and Tom hadn't even reached the legs yet.

Remember the toilet...remember the toilet... He mentally chanted, then got to work at making contact. A considerable job on its own, touching his boss' body, but after stomping on his own foot and forcing himself to scrape at the fur with the sponge, he was treated with the stains easily wiping away, much of the dirt flaking away on its own.

The flabby roof above him jiggled, the immense Pegasus having to clamp his jaw to hold in a tickled chuckle, but whatever other showermates weren't already chuckling and elbowing one another made no secret of their presence. The shower water and sweat condensating on his fur made his grip harder to maintain, and after seven minutes of having his belly's foot scrubbed, Soarin' felt he was barely able to hold on.

"...alright." Tom puffed out, satisfied that Sarin's stomach was clean when the last smudge of grass was scrubbed off and swirling down the drain...then he looked back. Even under the shower's water, he could see how sweaty Soarin's legs were, the grossly swollen limbs tightly squished together around the thighs even when he stood with them splayed apart as far as he could get them.

There was no laughter then. All the other stallions leaned in to watch, genuinely curious, and Soarin' swallowed nothing but air, knowing solely from their expressions that they'd hit the moment of truth.

Tom took one step. That step became two, then three, and then four, each subsequent one an event, all an action that left considerable toll on his mind, body, and soul. His legs were soon a foot away from his face, his eyes observing the blobby arch like the towering gateway to some fantasy villain's layer...and with one last pause to station his mind, he abruptly thrust the sponge in between his legs and scrubbed up and down, cheeks bulging as any air in his stomach was vomited up.

Soarin's face bugged at the sensation, frenzied between surprise and a tickled smile all at the same time, while the rest of the guys ceased any sense of class and burst out in a choir of laughter.

Remember the toilet...remember the toilet... He continuously recited, his body only able to register the command of making his arm go up, and down, up, and down...

...and then he felt his arm grace against something...not his leg. Something tender. And he, as well as Soarin, he could tell by the tensing in his muscles, froze.


Choice 1: Tom eventually manages to scrub Soarin' clean, much to the teasing of their comrades.

Choice 2: Soarin' sneezes during the cleaning, accidentally letting go of his stomach!

1551321222.content:
Soarin knew that it was an accident when Tom brushed his arm up against his what his stomach usually covered up. He knew that when he asked for some ‘help’, he should have at least expected something like this to happen. But Soarin, out of reflex and shock, still tender up his muscles. His grip on his massive boulder of a gut was already slipping from the rapidly falling energy in his bloated arms, the dampness of his fur, and the playful teasing his Squaddies were giving both of them.

But when Soarin tensed up his muscles underneath all of the pillowy layers of fat on him, that was the final nail in the coffin. His blubber reacted with a quiver, just large enough for the fuzzy armfuls of belly he was holding to slip from his grasp. Before he could react, his hot air balloon of a stomach crashed down onto the tiled, cloudy floor.

Tom let out a shriek of surprise as his legs and torso were suddenly smothered by pale cornflower blue belly blubber, his now body pinned to the floor. He could here the others go silent for a moment, before bursting out guffawing louder than ever before. The immense weight pushing down on his body was thankfully canceled out for the most part by the plushness and give of the commander’s lard.

“Oh no. Oh no, no, no, no!” Soarin cried as he felt Tom squirm in futility underneath his stomach. He was beet red from embarrassment: some of which came from acting so unprofessionally in front of his men, but most of it was from slipping up and potentially hurting someone. “Dude, I am SO sorry! Are you okay, are you hurt?!”

“Y- yeah, I’m fine!” Tom shouted from underneath, struggling to keep his neck from being swallowed up by a rogue wave of blubber. He wasn't in any pain, just immobilized, but he wanted-no, needed to get out from under Soarin as soon as possible. The blood rushing to his cheeks was a clear testament to that...if anyone could have seen it. “Just...just try to get me out of here, please?”

“O-okay...alright.” Soarin slowly waddled forwards, careful not to step on his accidental victim as his heavy hooves flattened the tiled cloud beneath him. It was slow going, but soon Tom could feel the weight ease off of his back as the fat slided off. Soon, only his legs were stuck underneath the Pegasus.

It was than, however, that things went sour fast. A lone bubble of soap from the shampoo of one of the chucking Squaddies drifted from the other side of the shower towards Soarin. At the same time, Tom, who thought he had enough weight off of him to wiggle out from underneath, decided to grab onto Soarin’s thigh for support. Having not seen his reaction to the scrubbing earlier, he didn't know that his legs were sensitive.

The lone bubble of soap from before managed to worm it’s way through the air to pop on the tip of Soarin’s muzzle, at the exact same time that Tom went through with his plan.

“H-hey, hey! Don’t do...do...ah...Ah…!” Soarin attempted to warn Tom, but could not finish his sentence as both his thigh and airways were being tickled. He could feel his legs go numb and started to shake, and just as Tom realized what was happening…

“AH CHOO!” Soarin sneezed. The gigantic, fat, naked Pegasus fell down to the floor ass first as his legs turned to jelly. For half of a second, Tom’s vision was of his serperior’s round buttocks crashing down towards him like a meteor from the sky. And than after that half of a second they're was only darkness. Darkness...and a lack of air to breath.




“Oh, thank Celestia you’re okay!”

Tom groggily opened his eyes as Soarin’s voice rang in his ears. The light flooding from the window in the room blinded him at first, but as his eyes adjusted he noticed that light was tinged in orange. He looked out the window to see the sun setting under an overcast sea of clouds. He looked back around and saw that he was on a reinforced bed made for someone ten times his size in some kind of infirmary…

...with a familiar heavyset Pegasus, now thankfully dressed as much as his Wonderbolt uniform allowed, with a relieved look on his face. “I’m so, so, so sorry about what happened! But they're was this bubble and I got ticklish when you grabbed my leg and...I’m just really sorry!”

Tom looked up to the elite military commander who could rip his body in half if he wished, whose face looked as if he had just murdered someone. Tom was understandably ‘miffed’ about being squashed by a Ponies stomach and than sat on, but as he looked up into his assailant’s emerald eyes on the verge of tears, he found it very hard to hold a grudge.

“Hey, you don’t have to worry about me, sir. I’m...alright.” Tom reassured Soarin. He was lying when said that, however, or at least half lying. His body was devoid of any bruises or scratches, all of his bones were in the right place, and his head was still screwed on straight. But his lungs felt like they had shriveled up, brittle and liable to break with each breath he took.

“Are you sure? Do you remember what happened?” Soarin probed further, not convinced Tom was telling him the truth. He sat down at the foot of the bed, oblivious to the other end of the mattress rising up to counter his weight. Tom found himself gripping the sheets to keep from gravitating towards the same posterior he got better acquainted with not too long ago.

“W-well...I remember you uh...sitting on me, and than it kinda went dark.” Tom confessed as he grasped to remember how he got lit from underneath Soarin’s posterior. It was blurry, with fragments of faded voices sprinkled here in their in his mind.

Soarin smiled a very forced and awkward smile and looked away from Tom as he figured his hands. “You uh...you actually passed out under they're. It took awhile for the guys to get me back of my hooves, and by the time they did you were out cold.” That would explain the feeling Tom was having in his chest. It was starved of air and is having trouble suddenly having it again. The elite military commander smiled warmly “But If you say so. I’m just really glad you’re alright.”

“Oh, that reminds me!” Soarin got off the foot of the bed, allowing the mattress to spring back down to it’s original position along with Tom. “Spitfire forgot to tell you where you’ll be sleaping for the night. A lot of the Squaddies like to live off the base, but the Wonderbolts offer sleeping arrangements for those who...don’t really have a place to go at the end of the day.”

Tom sheepishly smiled along with Soarin. It was not very comfortable to admit that he was, well, homeless. The price to pay to get into Cloudsdale was too high for anything to be left over, and he was counting on getting into the Wonderbolts today or go hungry tonight. Soarin countinued, “You can stay in the infirmary for the rest of the day if you want, but your new sleeping quarters will be…”
1551321222.title: In which Soarin sneezed and Tom almost died.

choices: ...opens a drawer on his nightstand, showing a tiny bed inside.
15513212223.content:
“...come again?”

Soarin’s smile grew so forced that he was pretty much weightlifting with his face. “Surprise!...roomie.”

“I’m...I’m staying with you?” Tom elaborated, coming to grips with the various levels of how wrong Soarin’s offer sounded; that he was sleeping with his boss, that he was sleeping with his naked boss, that he was sleeping with the naked boss whose member he’d touched... “Is this some kind of joke?!”

“Listen, I promise it’s just a temporary measure!” Soarin’ defended. “We just need to reserve our beds for the squaddies to conserve space for their training regimens, and none of the other commanders were willing to spare up any space, so...”

Soarin’ paused, his eyes growing somewhat somber as he restarted his breathing with a deep, steady inhale of air, puffing it back out in a sigh.

“...plus, I realized how embarrassing today must’ve been, with all you’d gone through, and I didn’t want to make things any more awkward around for you here.”

Didn’t want, yet failed miserably at making their exchange any less awkward, Tom internally snarked. All being said, though, Tom was mostly taken aback to hear Soarin’ talk to him in the way he did, looking upon his frail, battered form neither the same amount of kindness and concern that he’d more likely share for one of the many recruits he trusted, flew with, and spent years training together with. He acted as if it was Spitfire whom he nearly killed, not a guy who was hired to wipe his crotch in the shower.

Plus, sleeping with his commander wouldn't mean he was sleeping on the streets, and the answer was simple for Tom to answer. Simple but not easy, requiring a few gags from his throat to get his vocal cords to work.

Tom’s lungs lurched one more time, unable to breath in the air to speak the next word, but managed to work out a single croak that Soarin’ could barely hear. “...deal.”

“‘scuse me?” Soarin asked, leaning in so his ear was closer.

“Deal.” Tom could utter in a completely flat tone, but Soarin’ managed an earnest smile at the answer.

“...and like I said, it’s a temporary measure.” He enforced. “Plus, as big as I am, I promise I sleep like a baby. We’ll get along fine.”

.....


“So, I take it I’m the laughingstock of the facility, then?”

“You? Nah, the troopies’ll forget about everything that’d happened by tomorrow morning.” Soarin’ answered. “If you’d seen all the stuff I’d gotten myself wrapped up in when I was a rookie, you’d be chuckling all the same.”

This time around, Tom didn’t have the difficulty of being required to keep up pace with Soarin’s mammoth footfalls rattling the floors and walls to the facility’s bedding corridors, the gentle-giant of a Pegasus having opted to let him sit on his shoulder instead, but Tom still had to endure quite a bumpy ride with Soarin’s waddling gait in tow. Having waited till nightfall to leave the infirmary, the once amber glow of sunrise that bled in through the cloudy surfaces was gone, replaced by a deep blue tint that matched a stark drop in the facility’s temperature.

Tom grabbed onto Soarin’s shirt to stay seated, nearly thrown off by a particularly shaky wobble from Soarin’s hooves. “Even if ‘everything’ pertains to ‘scrubbing down and getting sat on by their boss?’”

“Who do you think got me off of you in the first place?” Soarin’ countered. “I promise, the laughter ended the moment I sat on you. Give everything a few weeks, and they’ll be chatting with you like you’re wearing a uniform yourself.”

With the two approaching a particularly expensive set of doorways in the barracks, evident by the varnished ebony wood and the golden decals representing their owners’ names, Soarin pinched his meaty fingers into the pocket of his shirt and drew out a ring weighed down by a hive of keys whose net mass must’ve rivaled Tom’s alone, his thumb expertly flipping through them before settling on a brass one with a blue-winged head, then stepped up to the door by his side to let his arm reach down to slot the key into the lock, then side-stepped to push it open with his own body and ventured in side.

“Well, here we are!” Soarin remarked, flipping the light switch. “Casa de Soarin’.”

Upon seeing Soarin’s bedroom, and finally beginning to question whether Soarin possessed the strength to hop with his indomitable bulk, let alone fly, Tom wondered if Soarin’ even was a field commander for the Wonderbolts, or was really some lazy brother of Spitfire’s who happened to freeload in the facility. The only evidence that Soarin’s bedroom was that of an athlete were a display of trophies and award perched above the bed, which in itself was a massive surface that occupied nearly half the room, clearly curtained to fit Soarin’s waistline, but their refined appearance was overshadowed by movie posters caked over the other walls like moss, the room beyond the bed occupied by a massive couch whose cushions and armrests were battered by so many years of abuse that they were molded into a perfect death mask of Soarin’s butt, a testament to years being spent in front of a television on the other wall.

Sitting in a wooden case below the TV, displayed by glass windows, was what wasn’t exactly a library of video games as much as it was a museum, fitted with several decades’ worth of technology that ranged from the old and dirty to the new and pristine. Yet, for every console present, there had to be no less than a few dozen for each that sat in a bookcase spanning the entire end of the room across from the doorway, some of their labels not even in Equestrian tongue.

Soarin’ chuckled, seeing Tom’s stunned eyes narrow in on his selection of game. “...and before you ask, yes, you can play them if you promise not to break anything.”

“I promise.” Tom mechanically replied, slurring the words as everything about the room save for the games seemed to melt away, even his Soarin’ himself, who gave his catatonic recruit a concerned look before gently nudging him in the side with his finger, briefly re-awakening him.

Back to his senses, Tom scanned his eyes around the room one last time, an important question dawning on him.

“Where am I gonna sleep?”

Soarin’...

Soarin tilted his head to see Tom in his shoulder and smiled, but his heart wasn't in it. “That poor thing is it really the best spot for your size. I spend a lot of time on it, especially in the mornings, and I don’t think you and my butt want to get together again.” He chuckled softly, internally beating himself up about how stupid he had been for not thinking in advance.

“They're is...they're is one place you could sleep.” Soarin got an idea, his eyes peeking up in revelation. He turned so that Tom could see what he was gesturing towards. The human stifled a gasp when he saw that his boss meant his BED.

“You…” Tom’s brain went on pause mode for a second starting back up again. “...can’t be serious.”

1551331.content:
Changelings are one of Equestria’s most curious and fantastic races, with a rather infamous history to put it lightly. At first glance, they resemble your everyday, average Equestrian Pony, but it doesn't take too long to notice they have more in common with insects that equines. Their bodies are essentially a hairless carapace with webbed tails and manes. But the most notable aspect of them are their diet, which is solely composed of love. Throughout history, changelings took the appearance of loved ones and unjustly stole their love to sate their appetites. This behavior has led them down a path of infamy and contempt by much of the other races of Equestria.

That is, up until a couple of months ago.

In an event that had shocked Equestria to it’s core, the changelings, under the guidance of a miss Starlight Glimmer, began to stop taking love by wrong means and start sharing love and earning it by what basically boils down to being a good person. This change was in their behavior was so great that their bodies underwent a great ‘metamorphosis’ that, frankly, made them a whole lot less intimidating.

After centuries of cold hostility, Equestria had finally brokered a peace with the changelings, and diplomatic relations began construction in earnest. Today, the ambassador from Equestria to the Changeling Empire would arrive at the new embassy next to the Chrysalis Palace. The ambassador himself was a human by the name of Thomas Knox.

Thomas Knox, who frequently was just called Tom, felt cautiously optimistic about his new position in the Changeling lands. A lot of his folks back home in Fillydelphia still had lingering resentment about the insectoid creatures, mainly because one of them posed as a dead family member when he was too young to remember, but he wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt.

Stepping off from the carriage that had driven him from Canterlot to his new residence and workplace, the first thing that Tom noticed about the metaphomasized changelings...was how freaking fat they got in the past months.

Before the metamorphosis, Changelings were jet black with glossy, pupiless eyes with literal holes in their limbs from malnourishment. But now that they was enough love to go around and than some, their coats took on a healthy glow of color, their eye no longer reminded others of sociopathy, and the gaping holes in their bodies had been healed.

But for years the Changelings had been doctrined to scrounge for love, fight for love, take on others appearance for love, because before they was just so little. Almost everyone went hungry and survived on the equivalent of scraps. Now they have more love than they know what to do with, and although their methods of receiving love has changed for the better, their hunger has not.

“Well, well, well…” Tom heard a voice on his left muse, “...a Human for an ambassador is certainly unexpected, but definitely not unwelcomed.”

“Oh!” Tom jumped in his shoes, realigned his tie and turned to address whenever was speaking to him. “Hello they're! My name is Ambassador Knox, and on behalf of Equestria I look forward...to mending the relations...between our two…”

Tom wanted to say more, but his mind was in another plane of existence as he looked up, up, and up at the most prominent and important Changeling in the whole kingdom: Chrysalis.

The 3200 pound, 14’2 Queen of the Changelings looked down at the Equestrian Ambassador and gave an amused chuckle. Her chuckle caused her belly, totaly open for the whole world to see, to shake and brush the ground beneath her with the consistency of one part gelatin and the other part sandbag. As it jiggled around, Chrysalis lowered her face down to fill Tom’s vision with her flabby face. “What? Haven’t you ever seen a changeling before?”

Tom’s mind came back to him and immediately he was kicked out of his stupefied expression. “S-s-sorry, your majesty! Yes, I’ve am well familiar with Changelings and your race...I just wasn't expecting to see you so soon is all!” He chuckled nervously as Chrysalis looked over him not unlike a cook appraising a well-roasted turkey, or a child smiling fondly at their favorite stuffed animal.

“Forgive me for the intrusion, I just wanted to see who Celestia and Luna had picked for the job. I was half expecting one of the Mane six to fill your shoes.” She raised her head up high again, towering over Tom by more than a foot. “But you seem just, if not more capable than them, if you don’t mind me saying so.”

“O-oh…” A small tint of rose cape up on his cheeks. “Gosh, I...don’t mind you saying that at all, miss Chrysa-I mean Queen Chrysalis!” Tom corrected halfway through his sentence. One compliment and he was already slipping?! Thankfully, Chrysalis didn't get offended by his misnaming. In fact, all he did was elist a more genuine smile from her.

“I hope I can count on you to help improve this kingdom’s...,let’s say ‘image problem’. People still are apprehensive about my little changelings...apprehensive about me.” She grimaced for a split second, but instantly replaced it with an enthusiastic smile. “But we don’t have to talk about that know! Please, just walk inside the embassy and someone will show you to your office. I’m sure we will see each other soon...very soon.”

With an added comment that came off as more dark than intended, Chrysalis turned around and walked to her place next door, giving the human ambassador a teasing view of her bare backside. Tom turned to his right to avoid staring at it for too long, another tinge of red creeping onto his face, and saw that a crew of rotund changelings, but not as much as their queen, were already unloading the carriage and hauling off his luggage inside.

There was no time to waste, apparently. It was time for Tom to head inside and began his new job as the ambassador to the Changeling Kingdom from Equestria. The moment he set foot into the lobby of the newly constructed house of diplomacy, he was…

"Oh, my!" Came a timid, rosy voice, but such a stark contrast to Chrysalis' booming cackles that Tom felt whiplashed by hearing it. "Hello..."

It wasn't only her voice that made Tom jolt in place; standing merely five feet away from the door inside of the lobby might've been around fifteen tons of a lardy mountain of adipose molded into place with carapace, its exoskeleton consisting of a shrill pastel blue with ribbons of pink banded around the waist and wrists. Standing just four feet shorter than Chrysalis, this other changeling was significantly younger, somewhere in her early twenties, and also carried very little of the revere or confidence that the Queen did; she uncomfortably observed him with deep teal eyes, wearing the kind of tiny spectacles that only secretaries ever seemed to wear.

Most striking of all, however, was that unlike the Queen, or even every other changeling he'd come across, this one was completely clothed, her behemothic form censored by a suit ensemble featuring a red work jacket that matched the strawberry color of her mane, buttoned down over a plentiful stomach that, while it would've only been 'mildly' fat if described off a normal changeling, still felt like he was observing some sort of oversized beach ball hidden under her shirt, a 'moderately' large pair of breast sitting atop that her arms were wrapped around to keep her stubby fingers locked, pushing her cleavage upwards as she blushed in shame.

...all of which was compensated by a zeppelin-like cliff of ass wafting around behind her, hips springing a few feet out from under either of the thick lovehandles sagging off her belly, dressed up in black pants that tired his mind of where there was enough cloth to buy to entirely cover them, if only enough that they still clung to the skin, laminating her deep, tightly compacted ass crack, bulky, engorged thighs kissing against one another, and stubby calves whose ankles spilled out onto her hooves, supplying her with all the swollen curves he would've seen if she wasn't even clothed in the first place.

The last detail he observed, one he damned himself for not checking first, was her name tag: Ocellus.

"...hey, there." He managed to get out. "Queen, uh...Queen Chrysalis said you'd send me to my office?"

"That's correct." She nodded, nervously straightening out her suit's lapel. "My name's Ocellus, and I'll be your secretary during your career around the office."

Scanning over her figure one last time, Tom shut his eyes and shook, his head, clearing up his mind so he could give her a welcoming smile. "Well, my name's Tom, Ocellus." He greeted, offering her a hand. "Tom Knox. And I'm sorry to gawk, I'd just hadn't expected to see you here so early."

"...I understand." She confessed, her foggy pupils observing my hand before she tenderly pinched it between her fingers, giving it a baby's shake, and seemed to loosen up enough that she could gift me with a shy smile.

"So, what's first on the agenda, then?"

"You'll have to follow me, first." She described, moving to turn around while waving for him to follow suit.

Turning her backside to him, Ocellus lumbered across the lobby, en route for a set of stairs winding up around the circular chamber that lead to a doorway on the upper level. With so much size to her legs, she stomped forward with enough reach that Tom had to powerwalk to catch up with her, but she still found herself staggering to keep up a consistent pace, her buttocks swinging side to side so often that he couldn't tell if she was trying to seduce him or was fighting their momentum to keep them from making her fall over.

"To begin with, Chrysalis wished me to inform you that some delegates of hers will be around in three hours to brief you on the specifics of your position and assign you to your first diplomacy missions. As your secretary, I'm here to help keep your meetings on schedule or arrange any calls you receive in accordance to your duties, or help in any way I can offer to help you on the job."

"Mm-hmm." Tom scratched his cheek to cover his lower gaze, forcing himself not to stare at the gigantic, ponderous orbs jiggling along her behind.

"Any calls I receive will require your direct permission for me to forward to your phone, as well as any business legislatures that I observe which match any criteria you place on me to look out for." Reaching the doorway, she drew out a golden key from her jacket pocket. "This will be your main key, and thus...:

Twisting the tip into the lock, Ocellus drew open the doorway and stomped inside, standing aside for him to have space to enter...and what space there was inside. A spacious, red-carpeted room wait for him with a mahogany desk with finish painted on that seemed to add centuries worth of age and experience to the wooden furnishing, complete with a maroon leather chair inviting him to sit down. Either wall was covered by bookcases, one fitted with an unused fireplace in the center, while the entire back of the office was made of windows, with marble pillars bordering where the glass pains flexed outwards.

"The books are all blank, but you're free to request any literature of your choosing to take their place." She added.

After freely wandering around in the room, jaw hanging wider with every new detail to take in, Tom stopped by his desk and lifted up a brass lamp sitting in reach of the chair, observing the bottom.

"Where's the button for the secret hideout?"

Ocellus merely turned her head aside, trying to keep a neutral face, but Tom smiled to match a snicker that she gave out.
15513311.title: ...greeted by his new secretary, Ocellus.

155133111.content:
“Well than, if that will be all Mr. Ambassador, I have to get started I my work. If you need me for anything I’ll be right outside the door.” Ocellus gave a polite and professional bow and move to exit Tom’s new office. However, before she could, she felt a small, human hand tug at her arm.

“Wait a minute!” Tom implored, trying to get Ocellus’s attention by grabbing at her hanging limb. “Do you think you have time to...you know, just chat and get to know each other better? If we’re going to work together, I would like to know more about the person who handles my schedule.”

The fully clothed changeling was silent for a moment, before color rose to her chubby cheeks, which we even more pronounced by the gentle and bashful smile Tom had elicited from her. “O-oh...alrighty than, if that is what you desire, Mr. Knox”.

“Please,” Tom gestured for Ocellus to sit down on one of the chairs across from his desk. “Call me Tom. Mr. Knox sounds too stuffy and uptight if you ask me.”

Following Tom to his desk and sitting down in one of the chairs, Ocellus flustered expression intensified. “As you wish...Mr. Tom.” She compromised, much to her superior’s amusement. He heard a series of freaks and moans from the other side of his desk as his secretary sat down. He subtly straightened his back and leaned a tad forward to inspect the damage. The chairs were designed to fit the girth and weight of the average Changeling, but Ocellus obviously exceeded the furniture’s limits with clothed thigh flap spilling out under the arm rests.

“Are you comfortable?” Tom noticed Ocellus’s pained expression as she sighed and shifted around in her seating.

“It’s just something I have to deal with. Most of the love I get is put on my behind. At first I thought it was pretty cool, because before the metamorphosis I was pretty much a wallflower. But all those stares and compliments turned to slaps on the ass and whistles for attention.” Ocellus sighed, letting her foggy, teal eyes droop.

“Is that why you where pants?” Tom inquired putting the pieces together.

Ocellus took a deep breath and gave out another sigh. “Yeah. I hate them to death, honestly. They're tight and stuffy, and I keep having to buy new ones because whenever I bend down, they rip. But it’s a small price to pay for random strangers on the street not grabbing my ass.”

“Does it really work?” Tom made a face. Even with enough cloth to cover her cliff like rear end, it was still a staggering sight. It seemed to him that it would stand out either way, with or without trying to cover up her skin. “And if it really bothers you that much, than why not wear something more stretchy?”

“But that...that would make me look enormous!” Ocellus hesitated, eyeballing Tom with a horrified expression. The ambassador merely looked at her and she immediately got the message. “I know, I know, but ‘you ARE enormous!’ right?”

Helplessly, Tom shrugged. “If you want my advice, you’ve got what you’ve got. And you’re going to have a tough time hiding any of it,” he added, gesturing at her form.

“So might as well embrace it, and show off your figure instead,” Tom continued. “You’re going to draw some attention either way, if I may be perfectly frank.”


“But…But...everyone will stare!” Ocellus protested. “And not in a good way either. Oh, who am I fooling? I shouldn’t bother dressing like a normal changeling anyway…”

“What!? Why? If you walk around wearing a bag, that wouldn’t look good either. You’ll still get stared at. And you STILL wouldn’t be able to hide.” Ocellus looked alarmed, but he just shrugged. “If you don’t like what you're wearing, than why wear it? Humans wear clothes because we need them to adapt to different climates. If it’s cold, we put on clothes. If it’s hot, than you take ‘me off. It sounds to me your just giving yourself mindless torture!”

Ocellus frowned and gestured to her big bottom again. “You wanna know how I got this? I used to feed off of people liking me for who I am, but than my ass came in and...and…”

“And it’s not real love?” Tom finished for her, to which Ocellus nodded silently. “I think your trying to apply your old self-image to the new you. But this is your reality now, and you’ve got to make a new one. Make it one you can live with! I think if you were a little bit more confident, a little more proud of what you saw in the mirror each morning, people would see both you AND your ass!”

There was a pregnant pause where she was completely nonplussed, but then Ocellus started to giggle. I let than dawned on Tom that he just said something a boss would never say to their secretary and he blushed bright scarlet as he nervously joined in. Her soft chuckle set the chair squished under her boulders creaking again, exacerbated by the pressure they were under, and Tom couldn’t help but look. She caught him, and immediately clamped an arm on her thigh. “Don’t make me laugh,” she laughed. “Not while wearing this!”

“I’m just worried about the chair in my super cool new office,” he said defensively, refusing to look away this time. “Please don’t break it.”

“I’m resisting the urge to stretch. This is really tight on my back, and kinda cramped.” She tried to slip her hand down the side of the furnishing but couldn’t only wedge a few fingers between thigh and the wood. “Hard to breathe in, too.” Ocellus gave him a curious look, her eyes difficult for Tom to read.

“You know...I haven’t felt this in a long time.” Ocellus smiled, which only confused Tom further. She grinned wider and patted her chubby stomach affectionately. Was it looking a little fuller than usual?

“It’s been a while since anyone gave me any real love.” She rubbed her soft tummy, which seemed to expand bit by bit the more Tom stared down at it. “I almost forgot what it felt like to have inside me.”

“Oh...oh no! I-I didn’t mean to...or I thought I was-“ Tom rambled on, feeling almost as embarrassed and flustered as Ocellus was a couple of minutes ago.

“It’s fine ‘Mr. Tom’”. Ocellus giggled whilst giving her stomach one final pat. “There’s no crime in the Changeling Kingdom for giving someone love. Chrysalis knows I needed it…”

1551331111.content:
Looking rather content, Ocellus held a hand underneath her well-fed middle, the bulbous surface underneath her shirt noticeably more rounded and taut with her arm pressed up against its skin, but she let go of her smile when an unmistakeable noise croaked inside of her stomach, and its firm appearance much more pliant to the touch. Doughy chitin oozed through her fingers, her entire arm seemingly sinking into the blubber as her stomach was emptied of its contents, but Tom could vaguely notice that her midsection was really plumpening up again, actually engulfing her arm whilst puffing outwards a few extra inches.

Ocellus blushed again, but learned to smile back at Tom, the two sharing a chortle at her brief expense...but then her face seized up in fear, knowingly tracing her hands backwards to feel at her own behind.

“No...” She whimpered, hearing yet another faint bubbling inside of her belly. “No, no, not now! Please!”

Sadly, totally ignorant to her begging and attempts her flanks to keep them contained, Ocellus’ asscheeks ballooned with a growth spurt much more noticeable than her stomach’s, forcing even more paunch from her thighs and lovehandles to ooze through and around the chair’s armrests before the expensive wooden arches were both flung off with two loud pops, both getting tossed aside with record distances. A sickening crunch came from behind when her ass swelled backwards to put enough strain on the backboard to smash it off as well, rendering the seat but an impressive footrest whose reinforced metal legs groaned in agony.

Ocellus’ face conducted a symphony of terrified emotions at the sensation; embarrassment, fear, and pain, her legs twitching uncomfortably as her pants became hard-pressed at finding more rolls or dimples to conform to, the material becoming even more strained while the poor girl’s underwear was probably strangling any blood trying to go below the waist. As if to cover the evidence, and with less of the chair’s dimensions present to keep her thighs imprisoned, her entire form sank downwards upon the broken seat and its supports, assfat cascading over and around the wood and seeping into the open spaces underneath till she was merely spitting on the ground, albeit with chunks of splintered wood and metal devoured by her even more gargantuan behind.

Staring into Tom’s concerned eyes in terror, Ocellus’ mouth open and closed, over and over as she tried to find the words to make up for what just happened, before she settled on hanging her head in shame. “I-I’m so sorry, I’ll just...see myself out, then...forever.”

“Hey, Ocellus, listen, it’s not a big deal!” Tom quickly insisted. “I promise, I was just kidding about what I said earlier about the chair. I hadn’t even sat in it yet!”

“Well, you won’t now, because of me” Ocellus bitterly snarked back, shifting around in big, cumbersome movements to get back on her hooves.

“Here, let me help you!” Tom came down in front of Ocellus and took her hands, trying to help and pull backwards to get her standing again. Probably a useless offer, given how much heavier Ocellus was than him, but Tom cared more to show compassion for the humiliated secretary, and was pleased to see at least a little of the discomfort on Ocellus’ face recede.

With a few strenuous seconds of the two pulling on one another, the soun d of wood clattering on the floor that was pulling loose from her assfat, Ocellus finally managed to rise up at full height again, but now sporting a suit whose pants were more or less black paint on naked legs.

“Thank you, sir...” She hissed, feeling how little air pockets there were left for her legs to breathe in. “...but if...you’ll excuse me, I should go change...”

“Ocellus, come on, listen...” Tom pleaded as she tried to move, just make any form of movement in her pants without ripping them apart. “If you want to takes them off, I promise, I’m not gonna stare or anything like that. I’m used to being around changelings bigger than you.”

“That’s very kind of you, sir, but...” She grunted out, taking considerable strain to swivel her leg so her hoof could drag just a few inches towards the floor. “...but I insist...”

15513311112.content:
Tom was a young, smart, and, at least to some, handsome human being who rose to political power by sheer will and determination. In the time that led up to his ambassadorship, he had dealt with plenty of tense moments, usually in meeting rooms drinking stale, cold coffee and trying to convince his opponents to see things his way. However, when the sound of fabric ripping from it’s seems filled the room as a large tear ran down the side of his new Secretary’s left butt cheek, it made those meetings look like pleasant afternoons in the park.

Ocellus’s face contorted with terror as the violent noise burrowed into her ears, completely freezing up as to not make the hole any larger. Artic blue carapace spilled out through the opening in the clothes, desperate to be released from it’s black prison. She could feel, despite his best efforts not to, her new boss’s eyes stare at the humiliating display, shame coursing through her veins more than blood.

As cautiously as possible, she took another step forwards to rid herself of this situation, run all the way home crying and comfort herself with a bottle of wine. Another hole split open, this time around her bulbous thigh. She grimaced an took another step. The fabric around her calves cane undone. Another step. Her other thigh. Another. And another. And another…

And than what remained of her pants fell down to the bottom of the floor, leaving behind Rainbow polka dot underwear in it’s place in food display for Tom to see.

“...so,” Ocellus sighed heavily as she continued to stand like a statue. “I’m fired, right?”

“What?! No, why would you be? Because of...this?” Tom looked at the Changeling a tad incredulously, a trifle offended that she thought him so...superficial. “It’s a wardrobe malfunction.”

Tom did not expect Ocellus to find what he said particularly humorous, but apparently he dis since she started to break out into a fit of muted laughing.“Yeah, on the first day meeting my new boss too!” She giggled, but it wasn't a very happy one signified by the single tear that rolled down her chubby cheek. “Haha! My life is freaking over!”

Tom fell silent for a moment, pondering on what he could possibly do to remedy this crisis. He tried to think back to to times in his career, and he came up with a solution. Back when he was fresh out of school, the nobles hastily put him on a sub-committee to deal with an international disaster. The Zebras, more wealthy and powerful, decided to launch a war on the poor and unprepared dragons. It was only by casting with bold force that Equestria strongarmed the Zebras into a peace treaty.

So that’s what he would do here.

Tom would be bold.

“You know, despite how much you say you hate clothes, I gotta say you have great taste in them.” Tom said after coming up with a solution.

“...what?” Ocellus tilted her head to the side as she heard her boss’s statement. She stifled a sniffle and turned around to face him. “What are you talking ab-?”

Ocellus cut herself off as she called her hooves around her muzzle. Her eyes bugged out and her cheeks went flush with red. Tom was standing in front of her, his belt buckle undone and his pants around his ankles, sporting matching rainbow polka dot undies.

“I suppose great minds think alike.”

For a solid ten seconds, Ocellus was dead silent. Than, she bursted out laughing, this time for real, as if nothing had happened before to make her embarrassed. Tears rolled down her eyes, of If sadness, but of out of control ecstasy. Tom smiled with a lighter shade of pink rushing to his cheeks. This is why he was appointed as Ambassador. He got things done, and he did them right.

“Oh...oh Chrysalis...you...thank you.” Ocellus said, catching her breath after a fur of guffawing. It felt good to laugh after all that just happened. “You don’t know how much what you did helped.”

“I think I have a pretty good idea.” Tom nodded, pulling his pants up. “Why don’t you go home and take the rest of the day off? You should not have to work after what just happened. I can take care of the grunt work for my first day.”

“Sir...I mean Tom,” she corrected. “That’s very kind of you, but I couldn’t possibly-“

“You’re stomach.” Tom interjected.

“My...my stomach?” Ocellus looked down to her chubby middle. Sure enough, it was filling out again with love, pushing against the hem of her undergarments. “You...Humans don’t have an off switch, do you?” She blushed .

“Nope. Now go home, before you get too big for the doorways.” Tom reassured his secretary. She grinned, and walked out of his office in her underwear and a new feeling of confidence about her figure. Tom shut the door behind her and sighed. What a morning.

1551342.content:
Appleloosa. Equestria's most famous western town, despite geographically being located in the country’s south. Divided between the native buffalo tribes and the ponies, the community was founded from scratch and underwent sudden and rapid population and economic growth. The town’s success can be credited to the soil and climate, which made it attractive to settlers who wanted to earn a quick bit on the apple bucking business.

The town was never really meant to be a permanent thing, which is why relations between the ponies and the buffalos exist to this day. Doctors came to treat injured legs that bucked too hard, a couple schoolhouses sprung up so that the kids would get an education and stay out of mischief, and by the time the people started building a park they had already set up roots.

However, the one thing that tourists to the idyllic prairie town noticed was the distinct absence of restaurants. Sure, there was the Salt Block, but that was more of a bar than place to eat. All the locals just cook from home, using the same recipes that had been passed down for generations, and chalk up visiting frustration to ‘City-Folk Blues’. It actually got so bad that the train station beld the arriving passengers dry, because they're the only ones who have any food to buy at the snack bar.

That is, until Tom came to town.

Thomas ‘Tom’ Knox. Human, native resident of Manehattan, newest resident of Appleloosa, and enterprising Restaurateur in progress. He heard about it through the ‘grapevine’ so to say about the restaurant drought in the small town, and saw fit to pack up his things and cash in on the famine by setting up shop. His family had been in the food business for as long as that town has been. His dad was a chef, his mom was a fast food joint manager, so it was only natural that he picked up on their skills. And now he was going to put them to use.

He called the place, ‘The Chuck Wagon’, mainly to coincide with the towns frontier living lifestyle, and the food he cooks best fits with the whole ‘roughing it on the trail’ motif. The menu consisted of baked pinto beans, coffee, Chicken fried steak, gravy smothered mashed potatoes, sourdough biscuits, peach cobbler, salted pork, dried beef, and smoky bacon so greasy that it had to be wrapped in a cloth. All of it was so far away from the word ‘healthy’ that it’s essentially on the diametric other side of the planet, but it his customers never complained, and they always came back for more.

So it stood to reason that the most prevalent thought on Tom’s mind was actually getting someone to stop in for a bite to get hooked. But after a full week of absolutely zilch, he started to regret selling his Manhattan Apartment to finance his little venture. A whole week came and went, and not a single pony, Human, or even tumbleweed came through those doors. Tom gave out a heavy sigh and set his head down on a the counter behind the bar. If this kept up, he was going to be out on the streets in a month.

*Ting-a-ling*

“Uh...hello? Is this place open?” A voice called out as the bells over the doorway rang their melodic tune. Tom lifted his head up in shock. A customer, finally! Without thinking, he swept his legs over the counter and fell to the hardwood floor with a thud, but that didn’t wipe the smile off his face as he approached his patron. He was a Pony with Pistachio eyes, a coat of gold, and a mane of amber. He could tell his was an Apple bucker by his cowboy attire and the definition of his muscles that only a lifetime of honest, hard work in the sun could give someone.

“Morning’!” Tom greeted the light yellow pony cordially, getting his attention. “Sorry about that, I’m the only one working here as of late. What are ya’ here for?”

“Oh! Well…” the pony rubbed the back oh his neck sheepishly. “Mah mama wouldn’t like it if she knew if I was here. She’s a great cook and all, but...well I heard about this place, and how it serves more than JUST apples, so I thought I give it a go.”

“Well, I’m certainly glad you did! Your the first, actually…” Tom trailed off, momentarily getting caught up in his own depression. He shook it off quickly though. No point in bringing this guy down because of his own worries. “What are you in the mood for?”

“Somethin’ sweet.” The Pony smiled warmly. “I just got back from the field, and I worked up quite a hankering sugary and juicy. Ya’ll got something like that...that ain’t apples?”

“Sure!” Tom returned the smile, making his way to the kitchen already. “Just take your seat anywhere you like, and I’ll have you food out in a couple minutes Mr...I’m so sorry, I never asked for your name.”

“Braeburn.” The Apple Bucker smiled with a tip of his hat. “Braeburn Smith”

——————————

After a few minutes, Tom came back out from the kitchen holding a peculiar treat that Braeburn had never seen before. It looked like Apple pie, but they're was no top so you could see the filling, an orange filling. As the plate was set down on his table, the Appleloosa native grimaced.

“Is there something wrong?” Tom asked sincerely, noticing the pained look on his first customer’s face. Did he not do it right? He did it just how his mom taught him, so it should at least look okay. The pony looked up at his Human host and forced a smile.

“Just...not what I’m used to, that’s all.”

“Oh…” Tom felt himself deflate underneath the weight of the statement. “Well...that’s alright! I’ll just get you something else and-“

“Hey now, don’t be like that man.” Braeburn stopped atom from grabbing the plate, having a sudden change of heart. “I asked for something that ain’t apples, and that’s what I got. Ain’t your fault I’m a rude guest!”

To prove his point, Braeburn dug a big chunk of the orange pie with his fork and stick in his mouth. The moment he did, his eyes almost bugged out his skull. The strange piece of pie washed over his tongue, his mind barraged by the new and intense flavors.

“...how is it?” Tom whispered just loud enough for Braeburn to hear. The Apple farming pony swallowed and licked his lips, a huge grin coming up on his face.

“What do you call this, again?”

“Uh...Peach Cobbler.”

“Peach…” Braeburn smiled and rubbed his toned gut in satisfaction. “I don’t even know what that is, but I love it!” He took another huge bite of the desert, this time taking less time savoring it’s flavor before swallowing. He already knew it was the best food he had in a long time. In under a minute the rest of the cobbler was gone, save for a few crumbs on the plate, leaving the light gold stallion wanting more.

“Here!” Braeburn pulled out a sack of bits and forced it into Tom’s hands. It was enough to cover for the food, plus a two hundred percent tip. “You just earned yourself a regular! I’m gotta tell the whole town about this place!” He got up from his table and walked out the front door with a determined look on his face. Tom felt ecstatic. It felt like the weight on his shoulders this past week have just been lifted away. He made a mental note to stock up extra if Braeburn’s prophecy comes true.

“...but how the bell did he not know what a Peach was?”
