15513421.content:
“How’s the plates for table 3, Cherry Fritter?”

“It’s out the window!” She announced, taking the tray from the window and wading past the other tables in the restaraunt, headed for the very front.

In the span of three months, Tom’d gone from teetering on the edge of bankruptcy to fearing that his newfound patronage would eat him out of his inventory, a harsh reminder to the price of picking the middle of nowhere to avoid competition. Many the cause of a cold sweat in what were once quiet day shifts spent in silence, but at least the cash brought in was a decent motivation to suck it up...that, and the silent praise that it was his dishes bringing in all the ruckus, as well.

A mix of all the races known to the quiet, dry plains were wedged into the seats; many of the usual pony folk, catching up on lunches or late breakfasts while chatting casually together, but a few buffalo sat crammed against the tables as well, unable to spare a chance to speak as they endlessly shoveled whatever food was readily available into their maws, their shaggy coats failing to conceal just how freaking big their bodies were underneath.

All filled with a pleased customer, save for a single table near the kitchen, at a spot readily convenient for Tom to travel to and fro from. A spot with three barrels for seats, ready for a specific reservation, but not for a group, yet all to be filled quite soon, any time, now...

“Howdy, Tommy boy!” Sang the very voice, but a minute earlier than the same time yesterday. “Got any of that ‘pitch’ cobbler stuff on hand?”

“Damnit, Braeburn.” Tom answered cordially, seeing the stallion of the hour squeeze his way through the swinging doors. “I thought you’d know me enough that I always do.”

...and Tom’s scruffed hair and frayed nerves were but a combed hairstyle to the change that took Braeburn over since he’d founded the stop. The infuriatingly fruit-illiterate fruit farmer was always to be seen at the shop nowadays, likely to be feasting on peach cobbler every day since the very first time he’d resolved Tom’s fears of closing down. At first it was mostly a friendly gesture, mainly enabling Braeburn to chat it up with his new friend whilst eating half of a tray, taking the rest out for home as he left, but as the days passed, Braeburn would take out less and less, able to fill up on more with every visit, up until Braeburn would leave whilst patting a stomach bloated with an entire tray. A week after that, those one trays became two, and a week after that,those trays became three...

...then Braeburn apparently decided shirts were too restricting, and opted to show his massive self up at the shop half-naked.

Even a few of the biggest buffalo managed a glance at Braeburn waddling past the tables, a few having to drag their own aside to give him room. The formerly fit farmpony’s footsteps shook the silverware and drinking glasses of the other patrons, the dried wood floors bending so loudly that Tom feared that he’d someday plummet into the basement upon entering.

Standing at eight feet tall, Braeburn carried a berth that was close to five wide; Tom was a bit too lazy to calculate Braeburn’s true weight on his own, but at the pony’s height, he pictured him having the frame of a human pushing four-hundred and fifty pounds, sporting an immense, wobbling gut that bulged liberally through the unbuttoned ends of his leather vest, hanging a sizeable distance below his crotch, whilst two rather feminine slabs of blubber sagged where those solid pecs of his once thrived, his arms constricted by the shrunken sleeves they were forced into. All above supported by grossly swollen legs whose thighs each possessed girths to rival a fat man’s waistband, his hands instinctually grappling with the belt to a parachute-sized set of blue jeans that Tom imagined Braeburn ditching someday and showing up butt-naked, his asscrack sculpted by the denim whilst the belt was consumed by his juicy love handles.

“Well, no, but we’ve got quite an deal of that ‘perch’ cobbler you’d enjoyed yesterday, if that’s alright.” Tom passively chided. He didn’t even need to direct Braeburn to his usual seat, only taking out his pad and paper as Braeburn prepped to ready himself for another scarfing.

Pushing the three barrels together, Tom waited as Braeburn got down to order...and cringed as Brarburn’s gigantic ass sagged over the furthest ends, flexing the wood and metal bindings keeping him supported. His reaction didn’t gop unnoticed, and Braeburn reacted in turn like a shy child...as much as somebody pushing a ton could, of course.

“So, how many would it be today?” Tom asked. “Three? Four?”

Braeburn’s belly greedily roared at the forethought of food, and the blush on Braeburn’s lard-laden cheeks darkened a few shades as he met Tom with that sheepish smile of his. “...how’s, uh...eight sound? Nine, probably?”

The pen and pad Tom was holdin g clattered to the floor, and Braeburn’s blush became so red that Tom couldn’t recognize their former yellow color as Tom stood there aghast, but soon blushed at what a poor host he was being and scrambled to pick them back up, giving his best customer a pathetic bow. “Certainly, sir-Brarburn, sir, I’ll get on it.”

Braeburn’s mood seemed to lighten up, turning to idly looking about whilst patting his naked gut, but Tom shuffled over to the window and eyed the seven peach cobblers he’d prepped beforehand.

“Hey, Appletart...how about ten more cobblers for table 8?”


.....



“Oom...” Braeburn partially belched, stroking a belly bloated and round with twelve trays worth of cobbler. “Thanks for not kickin’ me out, Tom.”

As revolting as it’d be for any of the customers to see Braeburn to glut himself so much, Tom’d been entranced a while before the idea to kick Braeburn out could come to fruition, just for sheer sight of seeing somebody’s stomach hold it’s waiter’s weight in cobbler.

Thankfully, Braeburn’s weight and gluttony didn’t betray his sense of courtesy, and he grunted to pull something from his back pocket, having to fight against the tight denim before what it was popped out and slammed onto the table; a bag of bits carrying enough to pay both the price and five times the tip.

“Duh...Don’t worry bout it none, bud.” Tom slurred, taking the payment and holding it behind his back. “Anything for my best customer, after all.”

Braeburn nodded at the sentiment. Normally, now would’ve been the time for Braeburn to get back on his hooves and lumber to the door, off to digest his meal into another hundred pounds of blubber, closer to getting completely stuck in the door when he returned the next day...but this time, Braeburn paused. Not because he was too heavy to move, as Tom first assumed, but because something seemed to be on his mind.

“Actually, Tom...” He asked. “There’s a thing or two I was hopin’ to ask you.”

“What’s that?”



Choice 1: For whatever reason, Braeburn needs a place to stay for a week or two.

Choice 2: He invites Tom to stay over at his house for a while, to cook for him.

Choice 3: Out of “curiosity,” Braeburn “hypothetically” asks “for a friend” how Tom would feel if a guy asked him out.

155134213.content:
raeburn didn’t answer Tom right away. Instead, he paused for a couple of moments, slightly content to look down at his new Human friend that seemed to get smaller every time he saw him. His kind had always been rare in this part of Equestria, so it was a bit of a shock to see one opening up Appleloosa’s first restaurant. He looked so...cute when he first saw him. The perfect amount of hair atop his head and bare everywhere else, wide eyes begging to be kept safe and protected.

“Hellooo, Equestria to Braeburn. Come in Braeburn.” Tom waved a hand in front of the fellow ponies face and chuckled as he shook himself out of whatever trance he was in. “What happened, dude? You just kinda spaced out they're and...looked at me for a while.”

“S-sorry!” Braeburn blushed with a sheepish smile, trying hard to think of the right way to phrase his question. “It’s just that...well, ya see, I got this here friend, I was telling him about you and we thought of a ‘funny’ question to ask.”

“Really, Who’s your friend? Maybe you can point him out, I think the whole town might be in here.” Tom smiled and made a sweeping gesture to the incredibly crowded patronage in his restaurant. The whole town’s population may have been an exaggeration, although a more realistic figure would be a fourth.

“Buh...n-no he ain’t here, b-but that’s alright.” Braeburn inadvertently stuttered, trying to keep his story together. “Anywho, we were just curious, and he wanted me to ask you if...if uh…”

“Braeburn?” Tom began to get nervous for his Pony friend. Heads of sweat were running down his forehead and the side of his neck, evan though it wasn’t hot inside at all. “You look like you sweating up a storm and your under a ceiling fan. Do you need anything? I’m right here and I’m not leaving.” He took Braeburn’s free hand and squeezed it tight, something that always calmed him down.

“I...I...howwouldyoufeelifyouwereaskedoutbyanotgirl?!” The moment that jumble of words exited Braeburn’s mouth, he instantly clamped a hand around his muzzle in an attempt to push them back in. The scene gained the attention of the patrons in the room. Some turned away, trying to ignore it and go back to their food, while others stared intently, eager to see what happens next.”

“...Cherry Tart, Apple Fritter?” Tom called out to his two employees, one of whom was caught staring and the other busying herself with plates of food. “Can you hold down the fort for a few minutes?” Without waiting for a reply, he guided Braeburn back onto his feet and out of the restaurant where it was more private.

————————

“Ah said...how would you feel if you got asked out...by a-a not girl…” Braeburn’s face was flush after making a scene in Tom’s place. The two were outside behind the building, the human having chose a spot under a wild bearing Apple tree. “Would you...mind?”

“Well...growing up I didn’t really have what people would call friends. I mean, I had people who I’d go to school with and my parents, but we never really hung out or anything like that.” Tom started after thinking on Braeburn’s question. “So I guess if I ever had the chance to be with someone...like that, it wouldn’t make much difference who they were and what gender they have.”

“O- oh...well, uh...does that go the same for someone like me?” Braeburn smiled, still feeling embarrassed from what happened, but confident all the same.

“Did your friend tell you to ask me that, too?” Tom leaned his back onto the tree and lifted one knee over the other cooly, not buying Braeburn’s story for a moment and knowing full well what he trying to say. But there was no rush. Apple critter and Cherry Tart were more than capable to run the Chuck Wagon for a while. The pony had all the time he needed.

“Ah guess...ah guess not!” Braeburn giggled and rubbed the back of his neck with a smile. He tried to avoid Tom’s amused, steely gaze but couldn’t hold it for long. “I guess I’m just curious is all!

The two of them had been talking to each other every day for the past few weeks, but it was only now that Tom was noticing the way his ears flickers every so often, the way his hair and light yellow fur always managed to stay fluffy, the tone of his muscles still ever present underneath all of that new flab. “S-so...you wouldn’t mind if I ever asked you out...maybe for a couple of drinks at the salt block?” Braeburn gazed down at his human friend, taking a step towards him, pushing his heavy midsection still full of peach cobbler into him and the tree.

“Mmm...no, I don’t think I would.” Tom patted Braeburn’s swollen tummy gently, making the surface bounce and bob with butter soft fat. “In fact, I don’t think I would mind even if you wanted to go now.”

“D-don't you think it’s a little early in the day to go drinking?” Braeburn purred as he bent down to equal out their heights and hug Tom into his belly further with a strong arm, overcome with raw emotion.

“We wouldn’t have to drink. We could just talk and joke...maybe even dance if you’re feeling up to it.”

“Ah...ah don’t know how to dance…”

“Neither do I. That way we can suck dancing together.”

“...hey Tommy, do ya wanna go out on a date?”

“Sure.”

1551342133.content:
Braeburn didn’t smile, but he didn’t really shy away from the response he’d gotten. He merely remained in place against Thom and the tree, letting them both marinate in the silence. Thom expected, even hoped, that something would break the silence for them, that the patrons of his restaraunt had heard and were about to swarm out in an angry mob, but nobody but a few satisfied orderlies came out, sending no a extra looks their way.

“So,” Braeburn ejected. “The Salt Block it is, then.”

“I’m fine with anyplace to go.” Thom permitted, debating whether to speak in a friendly or romantic way, but all he could answer with was a dry, pale monotone.

“When’re you thinking? An hour from now, I suppose?”

“I’m fine with half that.”

“Maybe fifteen minutes, then?” Braeburn pressed, then literally did so by moving forward another foot, adding pressure onto his mark. “Ten, even?”

Thom, realizing that he was dangerously close to having his chin be trapped between Braeburn’s mantits, stalled in answering at the sight of the ample mounds so near to him, then looked back up with his face dampening in sweat. “I’m down for five, if you want.”

Another step, and Braeburn began sweating as Tom’s face was smooched by his faux mammaries. “Maybe even now?”

“Certainly. Let’s go, then.”

“Fine.” Braeburn replied, but made no effort to move and make route. If anything, the tree tightened up on its wedge against Thom’s spine.

“I’m ready when you are.”

“Sure thing.”

That silence again, only mired by a few birds tweeting nearby, with Braeburn’s green eyes locked tight onto Thom’s shy ones, and Thom unable to escape as Braeburn kept enough of his belly’s weight pinned to him so his stomach could come close to completely enveloping the width of the tree, as well.

“Not gonna hold you up.” Thom injected.

“Lookin’ forward to it.” Braeburn worded once more...and budged forward.

“Mind leading the way?”

“Sure thing.” Another few inches.

“Lead away.”

“Alrighty.” Thom could feel his feet going numb.

“Won’t hold you up.”

“Won’t hold you back.” The tree emitted a crack, its roots unearthing.

Realizing that the deep-red color blooming under his eyes were his own cheeks, Thom freed up his hands, ready to lead Braeburn there himself to finally get some of the damn beer he was promised in his body...then felt the firm core of food that sat just beneath the beefy lard that aproned Braeburn’s stomach. He could almost count the individual cobblers that’d Brae’d been sold but minutes ago, amassed in a buried sphere containing an entire refrigerator’s bulk of food.

At that moment, Braeburn realized what the difference between “contact’ and ‘touch’ were, the feeling of Thom’s hands pulling him into lucidity, clarifying the state that his more-than-a-friend was in, and had the idea to back off...but that thought was vetoed when Thom, who didn’t understand what was happening himself, groped his hands underneath the fold hanging on the sides of his belly, guiding his palms upwards to massage around the curvature of his belly.

Then the eight-foot stallion was downed like a cut tree, landing on the ground with a satisfying boom with his body splayed akin to a big, tubby kitty.

Thom didn’t even realized he liked what he was doing before he leapt up onto the peak of Braeburn’s stomach, but the cross-eyed smile that was splattered on Braeburn’s muzzle made him giggle right back, and the stallion’s lips couldn’t twist around to put the satisfied purr that emanated from his throat into words.

Thom spread his legs apart so his own stomach could nestle into where Braeburn’s exposed naval lay, and splayed his arms out to hug the entire horizon to Brarburn’s belly, his arms coursing up and down, conforming to its curvature and snuggling against his love handles and the underside to his make bosom.

It was so much happening all at once for him to describe; the cushy exterior to Braeburn’s gut, the fuzziness of his coat, and the goddamned adorable grub on Braeburn’s face that made Thom okay with never eating, drinking, or sleeping if starving to death meant getting to cuddle Braeburn for the rest of his life.

But then Braeburn’s large hand came down between Thom’s shoulder blades and guiding his head down against his chest, leaving no part of Thom’s form without any contact with soft yellow. His cheeks went flush as they felt the tuft of fur between Braeburn’s flabby pecs; even if he was covered in fur, Thom felt as though he was forcibly nuzzling the hairiest chest he’d ever felt, but the way their tips tickled against his eyelids delighted him.

Resting his muzzle’s jaw on Thom’s hair, Braeburn gave his most happy sigh, easily one of the two most comfortable folks in town.

15513421331.content:
Thom rested atop Braeburn’s fuzzy, flabby stomach and chest, his arms and legs splayed outwards in an effort to hug and squeeze as much of the yellow flesh as possible. He let out a sigh of utter contentment as he nuzzled his head against his sudden but no less loved boyfriend's jawline, eliciting a quiet giggle from above. Everything about the light gold stallion was just so...adorable, a fact that the human perched atop his torso wished he realized sooner. His brilliant orange mane, his pistachio colored eyes that one couldn't help but lose themselves into, the way his already puffed up cheeks inflated further whenever he gave his signature, ear-to-ear grin...

“I think I might be falling in love with you.” Thom said out of the blue, putting both of his hands down on Braeburn’s flabby pecs to life his body up. The earth pony craned his head up to meet the human’s gaze, a small smile creeping up on his thick jaw. Delicately, his pressed his muzzle into Thom’s chest and let out a soft whinny.

“Hmmm...what can I do to shorten that down to ‘I love you’?” Braeburn purred, sliding his muzzle across Thom’s neck until he stopped at his face to plant a little lick-kiss on his cheek. The human shuddered slightly, not used to the type of pleasure the pony was giving him and trying hard to keep up a cool front. Inside, however, he was a veritable mess of endorphins and love, wanting nothing more than to lay on top of his friend forever and ever.

“I...I want to make sure this isn't a crush.” Thom forced the words out of his mouth, indifferent to the few customers exiting his restaurant letting out their respected noises of endearment at the sight of the both of them. “I want to say that I love you, I really, REALLY do...but I’m scared that my mind is playing tricks on me.”

Braeburn smiled thinly, a tad...hurt that Thom didn't trust him enough to assure his feelings were genuine, but understood the fear that kept him from crossing that mental border. He was afraid of letting someone into his life where he was the most vulnerable, where the most damage could be dealt. For that reason, he was willing to take things slow for now, even if the pony was very, very eager to start. “Alrighty, Tommy.” The stallion let out a sigh across the human’s face. His breath smelled like peaches and sugar. “Maybe you’ll be more confident with a few mugs of cider in ya’.”

Suddenly, Thom’s entire world shifted as Braeburn lifted himself back onto his two legs with relative ease, almost completely unhindered by the several hundred pounds of plush blubber weighing down his body. With a puffy arm holding his human in place, the light gold pony walked with a spring in his step towards the only bar in town: The Salt Block. You know, I’m perfectly capable of walking.” Thom quipped, shuffling a tad in Braeburn’s grasp to get more comfortable against his furry chest. His captor looked down with a coy smile.

“True, but than I wouldn't get to hold ya’ like a teddy bear~” Braeburn pressed Thom evan further into his faux mammaries, getting a kick how the human attempted in vain to not get flustered and blush.

...

From the outside of The Salt Block, the place looked modest, cheerful, and welcoming. Clay and stone beams made up the building’s outer structure, supporting the terrace on the second story and keeping the old, splintery wood facade from falling in on itself. It's tough to see through the large, curtained windows, but the happiness and joy from within could be felt from the outside. Braeburn smiled, having visited this establishment enough times to call it a second home. For Thom, this would be his first time. He wasn't much of a drinker, but the happy atmosphere emanating from the inside tempted him to make a one time exception.

As the two entered the building, and after Braeburn wiggled his body free after getting stuck in the doorway for a couple of seconds, they were almost immediately welcomed by cheerful, vaudeville style singing and a feeling of comfort. The bartender is handling some customers, but still manages to welcome the pair with a wave. The patrons of the bar were not as bloated as Thom’s number one customer, but the effects of his food could be seen on their bodies nevertheless. The whole town seemed to be slowly getting fatter because of his cooking, but no one seemed to mind too much, or evan at all. Some ponies recognized the town’s only human and tipped their hat in a warm greeting.

The Tavern was as engaging inside as it was on the outside. Tables were made out of old, apple tree stumps with soft, candlelit lamps placed atop. The wall were completely barren, besides the lighting, most likely because customers stumble against the walls too often and would knock off anything on the walls. The whole place was packed, most likely due to the place recently serving food after seeing how popular the Chuck Wagon was doing in business. Thom was more than happy to share the monopoly he had over the town, it was much more easy to serve half the populace than all of it. Several long tables are occupied by seperate groups of people, all enjoying themselves, but they keep to themselves. The other, smaller tables are also occupied by people who seem to be enjoying themselves a lot, perhaps too much, if such a thing is possible. Even most of the stools at the bar are occupied, though nobody seems to mind more company.


Braeburn took a seat down at the bar as soon as a he saw an empty stool. The wooden furniture creaked ominously under his weight, but stood upright just the same. Thom was relegated to sit down on whatever space in the pony’s lap that wasn't taken up by his bulging belly.

155134213312.content:
“...glp...glp...glp...mft...”

When Brarburn’s lips were only sucking on the last clouds of foam at the bottom of his glass, he slammed the mug mouth-down on the bar amongst several others that’d been emptied of everything but a few little dribbles of beer clinging to their interiors, their contents all emptied into Braeburn’s stomach which, for its massive size when empty, was now bloated to outright gargantuan proportions. All the more of an excuse to have his arm wrapped around Thom, the dwarved human resorting to be sitting on the assfat that sagged out from his side, left with no other space to be seated with the titanic Earthpony’s belly sat crammed against the bar enough that it was being eaten by one of its folds.

Not that Thom cared, or could really argue. Literally sitting on his date’s hip was barely a thought compared to the feat of, despite drinking almost Thom’s weight in the brain-poisoning fluid, Braeburn barely acknowledging the booze outside of a red tint rising through his golden fur and a playful gleam in his peridot eyes, gladly making near-constant eye contact with his flabbergasted date as more and more cider was absorbed through his maw.

A few assorted guests to the Salt Block would occasionally stop by to see the display for themselves, as curious as anybody would be at Braeburn’s rate of consumption, but only responded by nudging one another and slyly sharing a few good-natured quips; clearly a repeat site around these parts. It wasn’t embarrassing for Thom; it all just felt like the same merry ambience that filled the bar with life and fun, but all it did was make him feel like the last sober man in Equestria; despite the occasional drink here and there, he’d never really drank himself into a stupor before, and that last errant of virginity was all that kept him from getting into the same mood as his date.

“Y’all ain’t just gonna keep staring until I pass out, are you?” Braeburn asked, tracing a circle around Thom’s spine that made him shudder.

“N-No, listen, I’m really sorry...” Thom uttered. Even if the Salt Block seemed like a jovial hangout, he desperately wished he hadn’t agreed on drinking as a first outing, if just to keep himself from ruining Braeburn’s night. Top it all off with his first date being with a male, a male who wasn’t human, of all things... “It’s just that I’ve never really drank drank before, and...I’m just kinda nervous, you know?”

Brarburn gave a deep belly laugh that sloshed the contents of his belly around, shaking up an errant of gas that passed his teeth in belch. “Ah, who’s there to be nervous around? Yer probably the most sober person in the entire joint!”

“Maybe, but...”

Rather than let Thom reason his way out, Braeburn looked to the bartender and smacked a hand right on the wooden surface. In a rehearsed action, the barman gathered several mugs of cider and slid them down to join the emptied ones before them, gathering the latter to clean them off.

Thom’s lips parted to offer one last word of caution, but Braeburn eshoved a mug into his hands as he took one up for himself.

“Brarburn, I really don’t-“

“Mmm.” Brarburn grunted in a tone that somehow argued his point before it could begin, his lips kissing the rim of the mug. With a staunch look in his eye, he seemingly directed Tom to follow his lead as he tipped the mug back and sipped at the cider within, starting in thin gulps. Cautiously, but almost in tune with his date’s movements, Thom followed suit, wincing slightly at the sweet, yet strong flavor of the foaming brew,

“...glp...glp...glp...”


.....



“Hhhhheeeeeeehhhhhhhh...” Thom wheezed giddily, a hiccup shaking his form that sent ripples against the bulging yellow globe he was greedily nuzzling. “Y’know, I thing I do luv ya, man...”

Braeburn knew it was a partial victory, seeing as Thom was too drunk to even drink past his first and only mug of cider, but he considered it a head start nonetheless. The cider that now flowed in his veins had turned his blush so dark that it robbed his fur of their yellow hue, having doubled what he’d downed overnight and expanding his stomach to twice its previous size, adding two or three extra feet of belly ahead of him that his boyfriend was marking as his territory.

Through Thom’s blurry vision, Braeburn almost looked like he was twenty-so feet in height and that he was only a few inches tall, clinging onto his mountainous exterior for dear life. What was once a strange curiosity for Braeburn’s growth over the past month now ran rampant without any sobriety to keep it contained, wanting nothing more for the love...yes, there was no doubt about it. The love of his life to get bigger, and bigger, and bigger, even if it meant he had to slave away at an oven all day to keep his fatass from getting hungry.

Being only tipsy enough that he could perceive enough of the world around him, Braeburn heard plenty of humored chatter surrounding them; some snickering, some even fawning about how adorable the two looked, and beamedm filled with too much joy and cider to make him care if they were that angry mob he’d expected earlier.

1551342133122.content:
It had been only a short time since Thom mustered up enough vigor to finish off his frothy mug of hard cider, but for the newly made couple, every minute with together felt like an eternity. Maybe it was because Braeburn recognized that time was getting away from them, or maybe he just felt that now was the right time to lay down and digest, but with a content sigh, he hoisted his denim covered posterior off from the barstool with his human clinging onto his alcohol filled gut.

“It’s uh…*urp* getting kinda late…” Braeburn chuckled with a dopey look in his eyes as he relinquished his hold on Thom, the human sliding off the slope of his stomach to the hardwood floor feet first. “I don’t think my...mama would like me comin’ home TOO drunk, hehe.”

“Alrighty than….” Thom looked up at Braeburn’s intoxicated face with a flushed smile. “Same time tomorrow at the Chuck Wagon? I hear that fatty food are good for a liquor damaged stomich...stemuch-Wow, I really am drunk!”

It might have been the alcohol in his system taking action for him, or maybe it was the added confidence that broke down any barrier of shyness, but without much of a warning Braeburn suddenly bent down and grabbed Thom up by his sides once again and sat him on top of his bloated wrecking ball of a belly. Before the human could register what had just happened, he found his mouth being invaded by the obese pony’s tongue. After only a half a second of hesitation, he returned the kiss, only for his love to pull away all too soon.

“Actually, I might drop by a little bit earlier~” Braeburn gave Thom a wink as he set the Human back down on the floor. “I’m one of those fellas who don’t get hungover...I get hungry.” With that, the golden pony tipped his hat to the bartender, who was always good for his tab around here and turned to exit the establishment, leaving a dazed, happy, and drunk Thom standing on the floor.

“Hungover...hungry...hungrover-God, I’m drunk.”

Thom did eventually find his way back to his restaurant slash home, having taken up residence in the basement of the building, where the slightly overworked Appletart and Cherry Fritter quickly slapped the drunk from their boss and put him back to bussing tables and cooking the food. The alcohol finally hit his brain like a ton of bricks to the had, but like a trooper he carried on, with no regrets about what had happened to get that wicked hangover.

Despite nursing a headache, tired as hell, and having vomited a few times, Thom spent the rest of the workday smiling, his frayed nerves surprisingly absent. He paid his workers their hard earned bits and bid them good night, as he closed up the shop and ventured downstairs to his basement dwelling. It was a modest affair, but no less of a home with all the important fixtures...more or less.

Thom couldn't deny the feelings he had for Braeburn were real. Before, he had the scary thought that it was just something shallow, but a drunk man’s words are a sober person’s thoughts, and with some alcohol still left coursing through his veins he came to that conclusion happily. He was head over heels in love. That night, he slept better than he had in a long time, the first good night's sleep since he came to Appleloosa.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------

At first, Thom didn't fully realize that he was in the middle of a dream. The human blinked as he took note of his immediate mental surroundings. He was inside some sort of hybrid between a castle and a barn, with round, marble columns placed on top of a wooden, hay-covered floor, and brilliant chandeliers were hung from the rafters. He was dressed in a chef’s uniform, and when he tried to pinch himself to see if this was a dream, he didn’t feel anything.

In the middle of the great room sat the dream version of Braeburn in his throne, with some slight changes from how he was in real life. One, he was an alicorn, complete with a pair of wings and a horn, with a masculine crown where his Stetson hat is usually placed. Two, aside from the crown, he was completely exposed to the elements, wearing no clothes and leaving his golden furred body completely bare, wearing no clothes and leaving his golden furred body exposed Three, and most obviously, he was the size of a semi-trailer. Where earlier Thom fantasized that a twenty foot Braeburn was big, this one was around fifty feet tall, with a frame of a human pushing half of a ton and more.

The mountainous pony was currently asleep, his heaving chest and bulging stomach rising and falling in synchronization with each inhales and exhales of air. Thom looked up, up, up at Braeburn’s face and found it so peaceful and tranquil. Without even thinking, he walked to the front of where his boyfriend's gut touched the floor and embraced it, letting his body be enveloped by the fuzzy, warm flab.

All too soon, Thom woke up from his dream in a cold sweat, not quite as hungover from yesterday, but still reeling from the cider’s effects. The human reasoned that the alcohol messed with his brain last night, which would explain why that particular dream felt so...different. Even as he got ready for the day and began setting up the restaurant for the incoming breakfast rush, he could remember what he saw last night in vivid detail. He was lucid, he knew he was dreaming...so why didn't he wake up when he pinched himself? Maybe he was putting too much thought on it...

Or maybe it was more than a dream.

Whatever the case, Thom’s thoughts were interrupted as the same pony he dreamt of last night entered his restaurant...

Isn't that weird? They explained to you something about a gender imbalance or something, but you hadn’t really listening. At least the orphanage staff were pretty nice, if a bit standoffish.

A sweet sounding female voice pierced through the wooden door. "Anonymous, get up, sweetie. We've got another interview today, so I need you to be up and attem'."
You heard the telltale clopping of hooves as the voice behind the door left, and with a heavy sigh you got up from the bed and shuffled your way to the door. Looks like you were in for another fabulous day in the land of sunshine and rainbows.
The door creaked as you stepped through into the hallway. Around you were already a few staff members walking around doing their business. Your destination was the interview room, the place where potential adopters would get the chance to make their case for adoption; a place you were all too familiar with.
You nodded as a cleaner looked up and gave you a sympathetic look before you entered the interview room. Sitting at the desk was Sleepy Smile, your case manager. In the other seat was a pony wearing a tasteful black hat with pink trim and bows, but nothing to cover her voluptuous body. She was currently filing her fingernails while waiting for you to enter.

Ms. Smile tittered. "Well, as long as you look your best..."
The mare turned to face you and gave you a warm smile. "Hello there, darling. I believe we met once before, but I never got to speak to you in full. My name is Rarity." She put out her hand for you to shake.
You didn't take it. Even after all this time, you were still a little apprehensive about these ponies, especially their blatant nudity. Interestingly, she seemed unperturbed by this and withdrew her hand into her naked lap.

You weren't so sure of it, but Rarity seemed nice enough for you to give her a chance.

info.brief_description: You wake up in the world of My Little Pony, but with very different ponies.
info.description:
Let’s keep the premise simple. You are a human named Thomas who, for some unknown reason, has appeared in Equestria. This isn’t quite the same world depicted in the show. Ponies in this Equestria are anthros. They have the same colors and bodily features such as wings, horns, and tails. One notable aspect is that Equestria is a clothing optional society. Ponies typically wore clothing for special events but otherwise saw no shame in strutting about naked. Ponies are all about average human height, except for the alicorn princesses: Luna and Cadence are about 8 feet while Celestia is nearly 9. Other than that, the history and characters are all pretty much the same.

This is the story about anthro ponies reacting to the appearance of a human and the relationships that follow. You can keep it at purely platonic friendships, or delve into some really kinky places. I’d like to allow the freedom to tell whatever stories you want.

Try to make sure you use good grammar and spelling. It doesn’t matter how good your story is if the reader has to struggle to figure out what you’re saying.
